__Description of Incident__
MVA - P was the 3rd vehicle struck in a rear ended collision. Chain reaction MVA.

__Injury Notes__

episodes.natural_language:
Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 involves client Muhammad Alif and is a motor vehicle accident. The intake notes indicate that the incident, described as a chain-reaction rear-end collision, left the client’s vehicle the third in line to be struck. LMPD responded to the scene and a report is on file. The crash occurred on Shelbyville Road in Jefferson County. The incident date is listed as November 8, 2022 at 5:00:00 AM, with the time of the accident recorded as 8:10 AM. The scene was sunny and dry. The event involved three vehicles.

Injuries and medical status: The client sustained blurred vision in the right eye, dizziness, hearing issues, and neck pain. EMS did not respond to the scene, and the client did not go to the emergency room or an urgent care center. The client is currently treating with a doctor and has additional medical plans, including an optometrist appointment. The note mentions the client is going to Norton Dr. Stephen Patton for care.

Insurance, vehicles, and claims: The client’s vehicle had insurance with Farmers Insurance, and the claim number is 7005284778-1-2, with the claim status listed as Accepted. A separate bodily injury (BI) claim is indicated as Unsure for the BI claim number, with the BI claim status Pending. The client’s vehicle is a 2015 Range Rover, which sustained damage to the back. The defendant’s auto insurance is West Bend Mutual Insurance. The defendant’s vehicle is a 2017 Ford Transit, with damage to the front of that vehicle. The fault factors state that the defendant rear-ended a vehicle that was pushed into the plaintiff.

Employment and representation: The client was not working at the time of the accident. Intake was conducted by Brandon French, and the attorney of record is Aaron Whaley.

Additional notes: The case record references the client’s ongoing care and notes that the accident occurred on Shelbyville Road in Jefferson County, with the incident described as a chain-reaction, three-vehicle MVA in which the client was the third vehicle struck after being rear-ended.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

Client called in this morning - He has police report - He is listed as Unit 3 - He stated that Unit 1 attempted to merge between him & a van in front of him - Unit 1 struck both him & van on passenger side - He has resolved his PD - They totaled his vehicle and he is awaiting the PD check to get a new vehicle - He will be seen at Norton's on Tues - He will also be seeing an ophthalmologist - Stated his right eye has been blurry since the incident - Advised it is highly possible debris or dust entered his eye during incident so initial Eye Exam would be covered with PIP - Advised I would let JC & CS know we spoke this morning and they will get things updated as soon as possible #cc
episodes.natural_language: Initial client contact on November 8, 2022, when Muhammad Alif called in regarding a motor vehicle accident. He indicated that he has a police report and that he is listed as Unit 3. He stated that Unit 1 attempted to merge between him and a van in front of him, and that Unit 1 struck both him and the van on the passenger side. He has resolved his PD. They totaled his vehicle, and he is awaiting the PD check to get a new vehicle. He will be seen at Norton's on Tuesday and will also be seeing an ophthalmologist. He stated his right eye has been blurry since the incident and that it is highly possible debris or dust entered his eye during the incident, so the initial eye exam would be covered with PIP. I advised that I would let JC and CS know we spoke this morning and they will get things updated as soon as possible. #cc
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

On November 22, 2022, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm directed an email to Ashley Becerra of West Bend Mutual Insurance regarding the AP92071 claim for Muhammad Alif. In that message, Sarena thanked Ashley for the call about the letter of representation, explained that she had reviewed the document and was unsure why UM/UIM language had been inserted, and advised that an updated letter of representation was attached for Ashley’s file. The email included Sarena’s contact information: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office line 502-583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note indicating a new email address.

On November 28, 2022 at 3:18 PM, Ashley Becerra replied to Sarena, requesting that Sarena’s firm be sent a W-9 so she could add them to West Bend Mutual Insurance’s system. Ashley’s signature identifies her as Senior Claims Representative for Casualty Claims at West Bend Specialty, West Bend Mutual Insurance, located at 1900 South 18th Avenue, West Bend, WI 53095. Her contact details include Toll Free 800.760.9250 Ext 3631, Ph: 608-410-3631, Fax: 877-434-9585, and Email: abecerra@wbmi.com.

The thread continued on November 29, 2022. episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

This external claim, AP92071 for Muhammad Alif, was handled between The Whaley Law Firm and West Bend Mutual Insurance during November 2022. The Whaley Law Firm’s attorney, Sarena M. Tuttle, sent communications to Ashley Becerra, a Senior Claims Representative with West Bend Mutual Insurance, regarding representation, documentation, and the firm’s W-9 information, as well as liability discussions.

On November 22, 2022, Sarena M. Tuttle responded to Ashley Becerra after a call about the letter of representation. She stated that she had reviewed the document and was not sure why UM/UIM language had been inserted, and she attached an updated letter of representation for West Bend’s file. Her message included her contact details and a note to use her new email address: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com. The Whaley Law Firm’s address and phone numbers were listed as 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104.

Between November 28 and November 29, 2022, the correspondence shifted to administrative matters. episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. The matter concerned an external claim, AP92071, on behalf of Muhammad Alif, with West Bend Mutual Insurance as the insurer and The Whaley Law Firm coordinating representation for the client.

The communications began with a November 22, 2022 email from Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm to Ashley Becerra, a Senior Claims Representative with West Bend Mutual Insurance, regarding the letter of representation. Sarena stated that she had reviewed the document and was not sure why UM/UIM language had been inserted, and she attached an updated Letter of Representation for West Bend’s file. Her message included her contact details and noted her new email address. The Whaley Law Firm’s address was 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with a direct line at (502) 357-9971 and office line at (502) 583-4022 ext 104; her email was Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a parenthetical reminder to note the new email address.

On November 28, 2022, Ashley Becerra replied directing that a W-9 be forwarded so West Bend could add The Whaley Law Firm to their system. Ashley’s contact details were listed as West Bend Mutual Insurance, 1900 South 18th Avenue, West Bend, WI 53095, with a toll-free line at 800.760.9250 ext 3631, direct line at 608-410-3631, fax at 877-434-9585, and email abecerra@wbmi.com.

The following day, November 29, 2022, at 9:45 AM, Sarena sent another email acknowledging the request and attaching the W-9, stating, “Please find the W-9 attached. Please contact our office to discuss your liability decision as soon as possible.” Her signature again displayed The Whaley Law Firm’s details, including the Louisville address and phone numbers, and her new email address.

Later on November 29, 2022, at 10:10 AM, Ashley replied, requesting that the W-9 be forwarded so that West Bend could add The Whaley Law Firm to their system. This mirrored the earlier request and emphasized the need to complete the secure setup in their system.

Earlier on the same day, at 9:26 AM, Ashley had written, “We are still pending a statement to finalize our liability,” indicating that West Bend had not yet received a statement required to finalize the liability decision.

The sequence continued into November 30, 2022. At 8:43 AM, Ashley reiterated that they were still pending a statement to finalize the liability. Shortly thereafter, at 9:26 AM, there was another indication that the liability decision remained pending. Then, at 9:43 AM, Ashley directed that Ryan Gorlick RGorlick@wbmi.com, who was handling the liability and property portion of the claim, be contacted for this matter.

In response, at 9:45 AM, Sarena addressed Ashley (and referenced Ryan) with the note: “Thank you Ashley, Good morning Ryan. Ashley has advised your office is still pending a statement in order to make a liability decision, can you please clarify whose statement you are awaiting? We are approaching 3 weeks without a decision.” This message was sent with Sarena’s signature block, underscoring her role at The Whaley Law Firm and her contact information, including the reminder to note the new email address. Her signature again listed The Whaley Law Firm’s Louisville address, D and O phone lines, and email address Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

Across these exchanges, the core facts remained: Muhammad Alif’s claim AP92071 was under liability consideration by West Bend Mutual Insurance, with Ryan Gorlick identified as the individual handling the liability and property aspects; West Bend sought a firm W-9 to finalize system access; Sarena Tuttle provided a W-9 and consistent reminders to discuss the liability decision; and there was ongoing confusion or clarification needed about which party’s statement was still outstanding to complete the liability determination. The communications spanned November 22 through November 30, 2022, and the parties repeatedly referenced the pending liability decision and the need for a completed statement to move forward.

Later on the same day, at 10:10 AM, Ashley replied: “Please forward me a W-9 so I can have your firm added to our system,” confirming the need to receive the W-9 to complete the setup.

On November 29, 2022 at 9:45 AM, there is also confirmation within the thread that the W-9 had been attached. The exchange shows that West Bend was coordinating the W-9 submission to finalize their records.

On November 30, 2022, the thread shows ongoing questions about the status of liability information. At 8:43 AM, Sarena wrote: “Can you please clarify whose statement you are still pending?” In response, at 9:26 AM, Ashley stated: “We are still pending a statement to finalize our liability.” Later that same day, at 9:43 AM, Ashley added: “Please contact Ryan Gorlick RGorlick@wbmi.com who is handling the liability and property portion of the claim.” Then, at 9:45 AM, Sarena wrote: “Thank you Ashley, Good morning Ryan. Ashley has advised your office is still pending a statement in order to make a liability decision, can you please clarify whose statement you are awaiting? We are approaching 3 weeks without a decision.” This final note reflects the impression that a liability decision had not yet been reached, approximately three weeks into the process.

Concurrent with the November 30 exchanges, there was a delivery notification from postmaster@wbmi.com, indicating that the email address provided for Ryan could not be reached. The message stated: “Delivery has failed to these recipients or groups: RGorlick@wbmi.com. The email address you entered couldn't be found. Please check the recipient's email address and try to resend the message. If the problem continues, please contact your email admin.” This bounce was received at 9:45 AM (2 minutes after the initial message referenced).

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

On November 30, 2022, an undeliverable notification was generated for an email titled “Re: [External]Claim: AP92071 - Muhammad Alif.” The message was sent from postmaster@wbmi.com to sarena@whaleylawfirm.com. Delivery failed to the intended recipient RGorlick@wbmi.com with a note stating that the email address could not be found and advising verification of the recipient’s address and a retry. The diagnostic information for administrators identified the generating server as wiwpexc01.wbmi.com, and the remote server returned “550 5.1.10 RESOLVER.ADR.RecipientNotFound; Recipient not found by SMTP address lookup.”

The undeliverable notification includes the original message headers. The original path began with a Received entry from wiwpexc01.wbmi.com (10.185.8.28) and then passed through NAM12-DM6-obe.outbound.protection.outlook.com (10.2.1.6) via Frontend Transport, with ARC-Seal and ARC-Message-Signature indicating Microsoft and SPF/DKIM results. The Authentication-Results show SPF as none for the wbmi.com domain, and DKIM as pass for the whaleylawfirm.com signature (header.d=whaleylawfirm-com.20210112.gappssmtp.com). The chain also shows additional Received lines through protection.outlook.com and Googlemail infrastructure (mail-pl1-f171.google.com), including DKIM-Signatures and X-Google-DKIM-Signature, all as part of the message’s routing.

The notification also contains details from the original message content. It records that “From: Sarena Tuttle” dated Wednesday, November 30, 2022, at 09:45:59 -0500, with the subject “Re: [External]Claim: AP92071 - Muhammad Alif” and To: “Becerra, Ashley.” The Return-Path for that message was sarena@whaleylawfirm.com, and the message was a multipart/alternative email. The header information indicates the message was a reply in the thread concerning the external claim AP92071 for Muhammad Alif.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. The client is Muhammad Alif, and the matter concerns an external claim, AP92071, referenced in correspondence between The Whaley Law Firm and West Bend Mutual Insurance (West Bend Specialty).

The first documented exchange occurs on November 22, 2022. Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222 (D: 502-357-9971; O: 502-583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com; PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS), wrote to Ashley Becerra of West Bend Mutual Insurance (West Bend Specialty) after a call regarding the letter of representation. Sarena stated she had reviewed the LOR and was unsure why UM/UIM language had been inserted, and she attached an updated LOR for the file.

On November 28, 2022 at 3:18 PM, Ashley responded requesting that Sarena send a W-9 so her firm could be added to West Bend’s system.

On November 29, 2022, Sarena replied at 9:45 AM with the W-9 attached and asked Ashley to contact their office to discuss the liability decision as soon as possible. At 10:10 AM that same day, Ashley replied: “Please forward me a W-9 so I can have your firm added to our system.”

Also on November 29, 2022, there is a record of correspondence indicating ongoing steps to finalize the claim and liability discussions, though the thread shows a focus on obtaining the W-9 and clarifying liability decisions.

On November 30, 2022, multiple messages circulated regarding pending liability statements. At 8:43 AM, Sarena asked Ashley to clarify whose statement was still pending. At 9:26 AM, Ashley replied that West Bend was still pending a statement to finalize their liability. At 9:43 AM, Sarena again asked to clarify whose statement was still pending. At 9:45 AM, Ashley directed Sarena to contact Ryan Gorlick RGorlick@wbmi.com, who was handling the liability and property portion of the claim. In the same 9:45 AM window, Sarena noted that she had received a “kickback” from the email address provided for Ryan—the postmaster message indicated that delivery had failed to RGorlick@wbmi.com and that the email address could not be found; she urged checking the recipient’s email address and retrying, adding that the problem should be addressed with the email administrator.

In addition, there was an interim adjustment to contact details: Ashley’s note at 14:55:27 UTC on November 30, 2022 stated, “Sorry try this email rgorelick@wbmi.com.” This appears to be an attempt to correct Ryan Gorlick’s contact address after the delivery failure to RGorlick@wbmi.com. Throughout the thread, The Whaley Law Firm’s signature also reflects their updated contact information, including Sarena’s email address: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with the parenthetical reminder: “(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).”

The thread also records the following operational details: West Bend provided Ashley Becerra’s contact information—Senior Claims Representative, Casualty Claims, West Bend Specialty, West Bend Mutual Insurance, 1900 South 18th Avenue, West Bend, WI 53095; Toll Free 800.760.9250 Ext 3631; Ph: 608-410-3631; Fx: 877-434-9585; Email: abecerra@wbmi.com. Ryan Gorlick’s address (RGorlick@wbmi.com) and the attempted alternative address (rgorelick@wbmi.com) are also reflected in the exchanges, with the latter appearing within Ashley’s 14:55 update as the suggested contact.

In summary, the communication history spans November 22 to November 30, 2022, and centers on updating the letter of representation for Muhammad Alif in claim AP92071, obtaining a W-9 from The Whaley Law Firm to add them to West Bend’s system, and resolving the liability decision with the appropriate West Bend contacts. There were also email delivery issues regarding contacting Ryan Gorlick, prompting a subsequent address adjustment to rgorelick@wbmi.com.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

Re: [External] Claim: AP92071 - Muhammad Alif

Overview
This matter involves the Whaley Law Firm representing Muhammad Alif in connection with an external claim, AP92071, related to a motor vehicle accident on November 8, 2022. The communications center on coordinating a liability decision and securing necessary representation documents, with West Bend Mutual Insurance (West Bend) handling liability and property portions of the claim and Ryan Gorlick (RGorlick@wbmi.com) involved in the liability decision process. Throughout the exchanges, the focus is on obtaining a pending liability statement necessary to finalize the liability determination and on ensuring the claims file is properly updated with the required W-9 information.

Chronology of communications

- November 22, 2022: Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm sent an email to Ashley Becerra regarding the letter of representation (LOR). Sarena noted that she had reviewed the document and was unsure why UM/UIM language had been inserted, and she attached an updated LOR for West Bend’s file. The message included the Whaley Law Firm’s contact details and stated that the updated LOR was attached for the file.

- November 28, 2022, 3:18 PM: Ashley Becerra of West Bend Mutual Insurance requested that The Whaley Law Firm forward a W-9 so the firm could be added to West Bend’s system.

- November 29, 2022, 9:45 AM: Sarena Tuttle replied, asking West Bend to contact their office to discuss the liability decision as soon as possible. She stated that a W-9 was attached in her previous message and reiterated the request to discuss the liability decision. She again provided the Whaley Law Firm’s contact information and noted the new email address.

- November 29, 2022, 10:10 AM: Ashley Becerra emailed again, requesting that the W-9 be forwarded so the firm could be added to West Bend’s system.

- November 29, 2022, 9:45 AM (sequence noted in the thread): The message from Sarena about the W-9 was circulated in the same day’s thread, indicating that the W-9 had been attached and urging discussion of the liability decision.

- November 29–30, 2022: Ongoing correspondence about the W-9 and the liability decision continued to appear in the thread. The West Bend side repeatedly indicated that a liability statement was outstanding, needed to finalize liability, and requested the appropriate representation and contact details. West Bend’s messages also included directions to contact Ryan Gorlick, who handles the liability and property portions of the claim.

- November 30, 2022, 9:43 AM: Ashley Becerra instructed contacting Ryan Gorlick (RGorlick@wbmi.com), who was handling the liability and property portions of the claim.

- November 30, 2022, 9:55 AM: Ashley Becerra reiterated the instruction to contact Ryan Gorlick, and Sarena asked for clarification about whose statement West Bend was awaiting. She noted they were approaching three weeks without a liability decision.

- November 30, 2022, 10:06 AM: Sarena Tuttle sent a follow-up, addressing Ashley and Ryan. She confirmed that Ashley had advised that the office was still pending a statement to make a liability decision and asked for clarification on whose statement was being awaited. She again stated that they were approaching three weeks without a decision and provided her contact details, including that her email address is the new one (Please note new email address).

- November 30, 2022, 9:45 AM (bounce notice): A delivery bounce occurred when attempting to email RGorlick@wbmi.com via postmaster@wbmi.com, indicating that the email address could not be found. A message stated: “Delivery has failed to these recipients or groups: RGorlick@wbmi.com. The email address you entered couldn't be found.” The bounce was documented with Sarena’s contact information and the note to try again or contact the email admin if the problem continued, with the signature indicating the new email address.

Additional details
- Throughout the thread, the subject remained: [External]Claim: AP92071 - Muhammad Alif.
- The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details are consistently listed as: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office line 502-583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com; with a note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”
- West Bend Mutual Insurance’s contact details appear as: 1900 South 18th Avenue, West Bend, WI 53095; toll-free 800-760-9250 Ext 3631; phone 608-410-3631; fax 877-434-9585; email abecerra@wbmi.com. The thread indicates that Ryan Gorlick is the point of contact for liability and property portions of the claim.

In summary, the case involves ongoing efforts by The Whaley Law Firm to obtain a liability decision for Muhammad Alif in the AP92071 claim, with a request for a signed statement to finalize liability. The communications show an effort to obtain a W-9 for system updates, attempts to reach Ryan Gorlick at West Bend, and repeated inquiries about which statement is pending. A bounce on the Ryan Gorlick email indicated misaddressing or an unavailable recipient, complicating the process. The thread repeatedly references the need for a liability decision and clarifies the parties involved and their contact details.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

In a December 6, 2022 email concerning Claim AP92071 for Muhammad Alif, Ryan Gorelick, Claims Representative III for Property & Casualty at West Bend Specialty (West Bend Mutual Insurance Company), advised Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm that West Bend had accepted 100% liability on the claim for Mr. Alif. He also stated that he had informed Farmers Insurance that he was handling the property-damage portion of the claim and asked Sarena to advise if there were any other questions. The email included Gorelick’s contact details: West Bend Mutual Insurance Company, 1900 South 18th Avenue, West Bend, WI 53095; phone 608-410-3278 or 800-760-9250, Ext. 3278; email rgorelick@wbmi.com. The message was sent to Sarena Tuttle and CC’d Ashley Becerra.

Leading up to that update, a series of emails began in November 2022 concerning the liability decision and statements. On November 22, 2022 at 3:03 PM, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222) wrote to Ashley Becerra regarding the letter of representation (LOR). She indicated she had reviewed the document and was not sure why the UM/UIM language had been inserted, and she attached an updated LOR for the file. Her new email address was noted as Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with the firm’s Louisville address and contact numbers.

In the days that followed, West Bend repeatedly requested a W-9 to add The Whaley Law Firm to their system. On November 28, 2022 at 3:18 PM, Ashley Becerra asked Sarena to send a W-9 so her office could add the firm to their system. On November 29, 2022 at 9:45 AM, Sarena replied that she had attached the W-9 and requested that Ashley contact their office to discuss the liability decision as soon as possible. At 10:10 AM on November 29, 2022, Ashley responded that she needed the W-9 forwarded so she could have The Whaley Law Firm added to West Bend’s system. Earlier that same day, Sarena had requested the W-9 again and noted the attachment.

Messages on November 30, 2022 show ongoing communication about the liability decision and the correct contact details. At 8:43 AM, Ashley asked Sarena to clarify whose statement West Bend was still awaiting. Shortly thereafter, at 8:48 AM, Sarena reported that she had received a “kickback” from the email address provided for Ryan (Ryan Gorelick) and that postmaster@wbmi.com had bounced the message, with RGorlick@wbmi.com being the intended recipient. Sarena’s signature included her firm information and note about a new email address. At 9:26 AM, Ashley stated that they were still pending a statement to finalize their liability decision, and at 9:43 AM she reiterated that Ryan Gorlick (RGorlick@wbmi.com) was the one handling the liability and property portions of the claim. By 9:45 AM, Sarena again thanked Ashley and asked for clarification on whose statement was still pending, reiterating the need for a liability decision. A later entry at 9:55 AM showed Ashley replying with a corrected email address for Ryan: rgorelick@wbmi.com, and the message included Ashley’s full West Bend contact details.

Taken together, these communications show the following: The case involved a claim identified as AP92071 for Muhammad Alif arising from a motor vehicle incident on November 8, 2022 (MVA). On December 6, 2022, West Bend accepted 100% liability for Mr. Alif and notified Farmers Insurance that the PD portion of the claim was being handled by West Bend. A prior, multi-day email thread (November 22–30, 2022) between The Whaley Law Firm and West Bend’s Casualty Claims personnel revolved around the appropriate representation and liability decision, including discussions about updating the letter of representation due to UM/UIM language, requests for a W-9 to add The Whaley Law Firm to West Bend’s system, and ongoing clarification about which party’s statement was needed to finalize liability. The emails document efforts to coordinate representation, confirm liability status, resolve contact/address issues, and ensure the correct points of contact were used.

On December 21, 2022, Ashley Becerra, Senior Claims Representative for West Bend Mutual Insurance, reached out to Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm following a phone contact in which Sarena’s preferred method of communication was confirmed as email. Ashley asked for an update on her client, Muhammed Alif, specifically requesting information on his injury, current treatment, medical bills received to date, and any loss of income. Ashley’s message was sent from West Bend Mutual Insurance at 1900 South 18th Avenue, West Bend, WI 53095, with toll-free number 800.760.9250 Ext 3631, direct line 608-410-3631, fax 877-434-9585, and email abecerra@wbmi.com. She signed as Senior Claims Representative in Casualty Claims for West Bend Specialty.

On December 22, 2022, at 12:29:39 PM (Eastern Time), Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm replied: “Good afternoon Ashley, Mr. Alif is still in treatment with KORT Physical Therapy and his neurologist. He was diagnosed with a concussion. We are currently awaiting medical records & medical billing but will forward them upon receipt. If you need anything further please do not hesitate to contact us.” Her signature block listed The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with telephone numbers D: (502) 357-9971 and O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, and email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, along with a note reading “(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).”

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

Recvd call from Client with Medical Provider information - He is having continued issues with his concussion injury and stated the last couple of days have been worse - Advised temperature changes can have an effect on soft tissue & hopefully it will adjust soon - He stated he was seen by Park Ridge Hospital in TN, Cutting Edge in Carrollton, TX (972-978-2525), Dr. Norman at Starlite, Dr. Stephen Patton w/Norton's & he is now seeing Dr. Mark Lynn at Lynn Stadium - Advised will updated provider lists and get updated RR out soon. #cc #Txstatus #Providers
episodes.natural_language: On November 8, 2022, I received a call from Muhammad Alif regarding his motor vehicle accident case, during which he provided information about his medical providers. He reported continued issues with his concussion injury, noting that the last couple of days have been worse. He mentioned that temperature changes can affect soft tissue and expressed hope that his symptoms will adjust soon. He stated he had been seen at Park Ridge Hospital in Tennessee; Cutting Edge in Carrollton, Texas (972-978-2525); Dr. Norman at Starlite; Dr. Stephen Patton of Norton's, and that he is now seeing Dr. Mark Lynn at Lynn Stadium. He advised that provider lists would be updated and that an updated RR would be issued soon. The note includes the tags: #cc #Txstatus #Providers.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 involves client Muhammad Alif. On January 9, 2023, at 12:39:54 PM Eastern, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm sent an email to Nona Bacote, with CCs to stimulus110@yahoo.com, Justin Chumbley [stimulus110@yahoo.com]m.com, and Aaron Whaley, thanking Ms. Bacote for the detailed email. She stated that, at this time, the firm would handle obtaining all required documentation and that there is nothing the client needs to do except focus on getting better. The firm had already requested the New York Police Report and had set up the claims from Muhammad Alif’s first accident. Their Medical Records Clerk would work on obtaining the medical records, and they asked that the client keep them posted about any new providers not already listed in the email. Regarding travel to appointments, the firm would need verification of those expenses and requested receipts; they also reminded the client that Kentucky has a travel reimbursement statute that will determine the reimbursable amount. Tuttle concluded by inviting any questions and provided her direct contact information, including a note to use her new email address.

Earlier that day, at 11:02 AM, Nona Bacote wrote back with a detailed request for records and bills. She asked that all records and bills be requested from Park Ridge Medical Center for the first accident on October 8, 2022. The account number is #F00116787480, it is under Muhammad Alif, and the insurance company is Farmers Insurance Company; the claim number is 700528477781. For the second accident that occurred in New York, she named American Transit Insurance Company as the insurer and provided the case number 1123215, requesting all records and bills from Norton Hospital in Louisville, Kentucky. She noted that Legions Orthopedic Hospital, third floor Cutting Edge Orthopedic Services, had treated her for both the first and second accidents and provided the address: 1401 E. Trinity Mills Road, Carollton, Texas 75006, with Gabe as the contact at (972) 978-2525. Dr. Steven Patton at Norton Hospital referred her to Kort Partners in Physical Therapy, located at 616 Executive Park, Louisville, Kentucky, with phone number (502) 896-9355. She mentioned an MRI with Innovative Open MRI of Central Florida for the first accident. Dr. Steven Abro of Annotating Hands was listed with contact (212) 857-8200 and the note “Pixie Highway Cervical.” She said she was waiting on the police report for the New York accident and requested that the New York accident report be requested, ensuring all police statements and witnesses reports from both accidents are included. She stated she is seeing Dr. Mark Lynn as a specialist for the first accident, at Lynn Family Sports Vision & Training LLC, 801 Edith Road, Louisville, Kentucky 40206, with phone number (502) 308-5966. She emphasized that all PIP forms must be completely filled out for insurance compliance, and again requested copies of all police statements and witnesses reports from both accidents. She also wanted to know who the insurance adjusters are for both accidents and the policy limits, and asked to be mindful of traveling back and forth to appointments. She specified that attorney release benefits should only go to Starlite Chiropractic, LLC at starlightchrio@gmail.com and Annotating Hands. She closed with gratitude to Aaron Whaley for his support as a friend and advisor, stating that she is hurt and needs action taken right away, signing as Muhammand Alif.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. The client is Muhammad Alif.

On January 9, 2023, an email from Aaron Whaley at Whaley Law Firm was forwarded to Justin Chumbley and to Muhammad Alif’s Louisville accident-law file, concerning Mr. Alif’s motor vehicle accidents dated December 10, 2022 and November 8, 2022. The forwarded message includes a January 7, 2023 note from Starlite Chiropractic addressed to Aaron Whaley and copied to Muhammad Alif, titled “Mr. Alif.”

Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 involves client Muhammad Alif. This is a returned client call. He reports MRI results showing a herniated disc and notes a new provider, Mayo Spine Clinic, for treatment. He also stated that he has a primary care appointment this week with Dr. Patton to obtain a referral to Mayo Clinic.

He requested copies of LORs to be sent to him. We discussed the New York Police Report again and advised that we are awaiting further information. We also discussed the Bodily Injury (BI) claim for the New York incident; Progressive stated that this is not their policy number, and that the police report is needed to dig further. The client tends to direct us or give instructions on how to proceed, and we advised that we have this covered and will do our best for him.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

On January 16, 2023, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm sent Muhammad Alif an email with the subject line related to documents you requested. In that message, she informed Mr. Alif that she attached the letters of representation he had requested and that she had included all correspondence to date from both his Personal Injury Protection (PIP) claim with Farmers and his Bodily Injury claim with West Bend. The note also included the firm’s contact details: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office line 502-583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a parenthetical reminder to note the new email address.

In the same message, Sarena conveyed a separate update from Ryan Gorelick, a Claims Representative III for West Bend Specialty, about liability on the claim. Ryan stated that they had accepted 100% liability on the claim for Mr. Alif and that he had informed Farmers Insurance of the acceptance in relation to the property damage (PD) portion he was handling. His contact details were listed as West Bend Mutual Insurance Company, 1900 South 18th Avenue, West Bend, WI 53095; phone 608-410-3278 or 800-760-9250, ext. 3278; email rgorelick@wbmi.com.

A lengthy email thread from late November 2022 documents ongoing discussions about liability decisions and the need for certain statements. On November 22, 2022 at 3:03 PM, Sarena Tuttle wrote to Ashley Becerra and Ryan Gorelick with a note regarding the letter of representation and the UM/UIM language she believed had been inserted erroneously; she attached an updated LOR for the file. The Whaley Law Firm again provided its contact details in that message.

During the week of November 28–30, 2022, West Bend repeatedly requested a W-9 form so that the firm could be added to West Bend’s system. On November 28, 2022 at 3:18 PM, Ashley Becerra asked Sarena to send a W-9. On November 29, 2022 at 9:45 AM, Sarena replied with the W-9 attached and asked Ashley to contact their office to discuss the liability decision as soon as possible. Later that day at 10:10 AM, Ashley responded by asking Sarena to forward the W-9 so she could add The Whaley Law Firm to West Bend’s system.

Additionally, Sarena reported that she had received a “kickback” from the email address provided for Ryan Gorelick, noting a delivery failure to RGorlick@wbmi.com from the postmaster address postmaster@wbmi.com. In the series of messages on November 30, 2022, a sequence of inquiries and replies followed regarding whose statement West Bend was still awaiting to finalize the liability decision. At 8:43 AM, Sarena requested clarification on whose statement was still pending. At 8:48 AM, she noted the delivery issue with Ryan’s address. Throughout the morning of November 30, 2022, multiple messages were exchanged reiterating that West Bend was still awaiting a liability statement and referencing the need to contact Ryan Gorlick at the correct address. Ashley’s reply on November 30, 2022 at 9:43 AM directed contacts to RGorlick@wbmi.com for the liability and property portions of the claim, and Sarena reiterated the question about which statement was pending in follow-up messages around 9:45–9:55 AM. Earlier that day, Ashley’s earlier message had advised using RGorlick@wbmi.com, after an initial delivery issue to the previously provided address.

In summary, the November 2022 correspondence centers on West Bend’s request for a W-9 to add The Whaley Law Firm to their system, the exchange of updated letters of representation (notably correcting UM/UIM language), and ongoing requests for a liability statement—specifically identifying Ryan Gorlick as the contact handling the liability and property portions of AP92071 for Muhammad Alif. By contrast, the January 16, 2023 communication confirms that all requested documents had been compiled and sent to Mr. Alif, including letters of representation and the full set of correspondence on the Farmers PIP claim and the West Bend bodily injury claim, with confirmation that there is new contact information for Sarena Tuttle. The case remains identified as Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022, with the client being Muhammad Alif.

This note covers the Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 case for client Muhammad Alif (referred to as “Mo”). The emails summarized below were exchanged on January 18, 2023, among The Whaley Law Firm team, with Muhammad Alif CC’d at muhammadalifz2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com.

The thread opens with a message dated January 18, 2023 at 12:01:36 PM from Aaron Whaley (agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com) to Sarena Tuttle (sarena@whaleylawfirm.com), cc’d Muhammad Alif MVA 11/08/2022. The subject line reads Re: Muhammad Alif "Mo" and the body simply states, “Sounds good.”

Earlier in the day, at 11:14 AM, Sarena Tuttle wrote to AW: “Hey AW, Client called in today & wanted to direct his PIP payments. I advised that you have to approve any & all PIP releases. His NY MVA has a $50k PIP limit & he has already stacked up quite a bit of bills. He also wants to schedule a ‘sit down with the team’ to discuss current status & how claim will progress.” Sarena’s signature followed, listing her contact information at The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with D: (502) 357-9971, O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, and E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, noting that this is her new email address.

At 11:44 AM, Aaron Whaley replied: “That’s not a problem. Probably need to start gathering records and bills as we go on his case so I can divvy up PIP a bit. You want to take over as case manager on these? You seem to be doing most of the communication with Mo.” This message also appears in the thread under Aaron’s signature block for The Whaley Law Firm, which lists his contact information as 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, 502-583-4022.

Then at 12:00 PM, Sarena wrote: “I had set a task for JB to start requesting - I see she worked on the companion yesterday - I will double check on Mo's Requests I have no issues with taking these back - at this point I'm just waiting on the NY PR for BI Ins search - Progressive was listed but advised that is not their policy number.” Sarena again included her standard signature block.

Finally, at 12:01 PM, Aaron replied with, “Sounds good.” His signature block followed, listing The Whaley Law Firm at 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, and the phone number 502-583-4022.

Additional context from the thread includes the following actions and points:
- JB had been assigned tasks related to requesting documents, and Sarena observed that JB worked on the “companion” yesterday.
- There was an intention to reassess Mo’s requests, with Sarena indicating she had no issues taking those back.
- The team was waiting for a New York PR for a BI Insurance search, and it was noted that Progressive had been listed as a potential insurer, but that did not correspond to their policy number.
- There was a plan to schedule a team sit-down with Mo to discuss the current status and the progression of the claim.
- Throughout the thread, Mo’s PIP (Personal Injury Protection) payments and releases were a focal point, with the client having a NY MVA PIP limit of $50,000 and a substantial amount of bills already accumulated.

Signatures included in the messages show both Sarena M. Tuttle and Aaron Whaley, with their respective titles and contact details. Sarena’s signature also notes a new email address, and both signatures provide their office address and phone numbers.

Muhammad Alif is the client in case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022, which concerns two motor vehicle accidents: one on November 8, 2022, and another on December 10, 2022. On January 23, 2023 at 8:22 AM, Brittany Clark, Call Center Manager at Aptiva Health, sent an email noting that Mr. Alif had been scheduled for treatment that day related to an auto accident. She stated that he had listed Sarena Tuttle as his representation for the auto accident that occurred on 11/8/22 and asked whether PIP coverage was available.

In response, at 11:28:54 AM on the same day, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm replied to reconfirm that PIP coverage is available for both incidents and provided the relevant PIP information. For the MVA on 11/08/2022, the insurer is Farmers Insurance, with contact Michael Santos at (248) 488-2779 and the email MyClaim@FarmersInsurance.com. The claim number is 7005284778-1-2. For the MVA on 12/10/2022, the insurer is American Transit Insurance, with contact Chevan Douglas at (212) 857-8200 Ext 1624. The claim number is 1123215.

Sarena M. Tuttle also included her contact details: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Direct line (502) 357-9971; Office line (502) 583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and a note indicating this is a new email address.

Earlier in the thread, on the same day at 8:22 AM, Brittany Clark’s message included her signature block with her title and contact information: Call Center Manager, Aptiva Health; telephone numbers 502-909-0772 ext. 2208 and 855-859-0123; email bclark@aptivahealth.com; website aptivahealth.com; and the office address 3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218.

The same email from Brittany also contained the standard confidentiality disclaimer, stating that the email and any attachments are intended only for the addressee(s) named, may contain legally privileged and/or confidential information, and that dissemination, distribution, printing, or copying is prohibited if the recipient is not the intended one. episodes.natural_language:
Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 concerns the client Muhammad Alif, who was involved in a motor vehicle accident on November 8, 2022. The matter titled “Re: Full battery Brain Testing Approval” was discussed in communications dated January 24, 2023.

On January 24, 2023, the email thread shows that the case involves PIP coverage for Muhammad Alif with the same information as that used for Kendra Fogle, as well as PIP for the accident date of 11/08/22. The Farmers Insurance policy number is 7005284778-1-2, and the adjuster is Michael Santos, who can be reached at 248-488-2779.

Earlier that day, at 5:22 PM, Cutting Edge Front Desk emailed a request for approval of traumatic brain injury (TBI) testing for MUHAMMED ALIF, who is a patient of Dr. William Hwang, MD. Dr. Hwang is double board-certified in neurology and psychiatry, with specialties in physical medicine, rehab, and sleep disorders. The desk note states that Dr. Hwang recommends the following procedures before treatment: Oculomotor assessment, Posturography, Neurocognitive testing, Brain Mapping, and MRI/DTI.

The TBI testing battery proposed includes the following components and costs: Oculomotor assessment at $2,000; Neurocognitive testing at $2,200; Posturography in this battery at $500; Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology at $8,000; and DTI/MRI at $8,000. The desk notice also invites learnings about multifactorial testing by directing the recipient to http://meet.ceostx.com to schedule time with Dr. Matt DeGaetano, and provides Dr. Matt DeGaetano’s direct contact as drmatt@ceostx.com.

Indications provided for each test are as follows:
- Oculomotor assessment: indications include brain injury, headaches, fatigue, blurry vision, foggy thinking, reading difficulties, cognitive challenges, balance issues, trouble sleeping, mood changes, blurred or double vision, nausea, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, and lightheadedness.
- Posturography: indications include brain injury, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, and lightheadedness.
- Neurocognitive testing: helps identify the brain areas impacted by a TBI and how impairments affect day-to-day functioning; it also clarifies how factors such as depression, anxiety, life stress, memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress influence cognitive functioning.
- Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology: described as the most sophisticated, state-of-the-art, real-time imaging/brain training available, enabling visualization of live activity in the Limbic system, anterior cingulate, fusiform gyrus, Brodmann areas, and more by recording 19 channels of brain activity simultaneously; brain dysfunction can have various causes (encephalopathy), including memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, cognitive decline.
- DTI/MRI: diffusion tensor imaging is an MRI technique that uses anisotropic diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of the brain, with fiber tractography (FT) as a 3D reconstruction to assess neural tracts; a non-invasive imaging tool to investigate white matter structure damaged during a TBI even in the absence of neurological symptoms.

The desk message concluded by requesting a response accepting or denying the testing, and asked that an LOP (letter of protection) be attached if the testing is approved.

The thread closing shows that at 6:00 PM on January 24, 2023, Aaron Whaley replied, “Yes, I approve.” The header of the original message is dated January 24, 2023, at 18:05:24 -0500, reflecting the same day approval in the thread.

Signature:
Aaron Whaley
Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222
Phone: 502-583-4022

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. This note documents communications related to Muhammad Alif’s motor vehicle accident case (MVA) and related insurance matters, including a second accident, a request for police reports, and imaging arrangements.

On January 26, 2023, at 7:18 PM, Nona Bacote sent an email to Sarena Tuttle at The Whaley Law Firm regarding Muhammad Alif. In her message, Nona advised that Muhammad had been seen by Envision Imaging that week at 12201 Merit Drive, Suite 100, Dallas, Texas 75251, with phone number (214) 276-0050 and fax number (214) 276-0057. The email address listed was http://www.envivionimg.com. Nona stated that Envision Imaging ordered an MRI, but the services were refused due to Muhammad’s claustrophobia. She also mentioned that she had obtained the police report for Muhammad’s accident in New York and asked for clarification about the accident and whether Progressive Insurance Company had been identified as the insurer. The message concluded with Muhammad’s name and contact details and was signed by Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with a phone number of 502-583-4022.

The next day, January 27, 2023, at 9:28 AM, Sarena Tuttle responded to Muhammad’s matter. She wrote that they had been in contact with Progressive and that Progressive does not insure the defendant in Muhammad’s second accident. She explained that the only coverage currently available was for the cab company, which carries a $25,000/$50,000 policy. She cautioned Muhammad that because the cab was not the at-fault driver, the cab company has the right to deny all liability, accept 50% liability, or accept 100% liability. If Progressive accepts 100% liability, the maximum recovery from that source would be $25,000. She also asked Muhammad whether he had under-insured motorist coverage on his personal policy.

Also on January 27, 2023, at 9:54 AM, Aaron Whaley replied to Sarena’s message, indicating he had asked Muhammad to forward the police report. The thread shows his request to obtain the police report for the case.

Later that same day, at 10:56 AM, Sarena Tuttle wrote again. She noted that she had Muhammad’s copy of the police report (referred to as the PR) and that Star faxed it over.

Finally, at 6:51 PM (UTC) on January 27, 2023, Muhammad Alif sent an email from stimulus110@yahoo.com to Sarena Tuttle and Aaron Whaley, CC’ing Nona Bacote. In his message, Muhammad stated: “Good afternoon after reviewing my policy it’s been discovered I only had $25,000 on a sewer motors.” The message was sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone.

The thread includes the Whaley Law Firm signatures. Sarena M. Tuttle’s signature identifies her with The Whaley Law Firm, at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with direct line 502-357-9971, office number 502-583-4022 ext 104, and email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting a newer email address). Aaron Whaley’s signature likewise reflects The Whaley Law Firm and lists the same Louisville contact details.

In summary, the communications establish that Muhammad Alif’s case involves a motor vehicle accident with a second involved incident, Progressive Insurance’s lack of coverage for the defendant in the second accident (leaving the cab company’s $25k/$50k policy as the only available coverage), questions about under-insured motorist coverage on Muhammad’s own policy, and an imaging order from Envision Imaging in Dallas that was not fulfilled due to claustrophobia. Muhammad also obtained a police report for the New York accident and sought confirmation that Progressive Insurance Company is the insurer for the matter.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

In the submission titled MUHAMMED ALIF Brain Testing Approval, dated January 31, 2023, Cutting Edge Admin sent a message to MUHAMMED ALIF (sarena@whaleylawfirm.com) regarding the brain testing needed for Muhammad Alif, a patient of Dr. William Hwang, MD, who is double board-certified in neurology and psychiatry and has specialties in physical medicine, rehabilitation, and sleep disorders. The message requests approval for traumatic brain injury (TBI) testing and outlines the procedures Dr. Hwang recommends prior to treatment: an oculomotor assessment, posturography, neurocognitive testing, brain mapping, and MRI/DTI.

The TBI testing battery and their listed costs are as follows: oculomotor assessment ($2,000), neurocognitive testing ($2,200), posturography ($500), brain mapping and electrophysiology ($8,000), and DTI/MRI ($8,000). The note invites the recipient to learn more about how multifactorial testing can identify brain injuries by scheduling time to speak with Dr. Matt DeGaetano via http://meet.ceostx.com; if a time cannot be found or if direct contact is preferred, Dr. DeGaetano can be reached at drmatt@ceostx.com.

Indications for each component are detailed. Oculomotor assessment is indicated for brain injury, headaches, fatigue, blurry vision and foggy thinking, reading difficulties, cognitive challenges, balance issues, trouble sleeping, and mood changes, as well as blurred vision, double vision, nausea, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, and lightheadedness. Posturography is indicated for brain injury, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, and lightheadedness. Neurocognitive testing can help determine the brain areas affected by TBI and how these impairments impact day-to-day functioning; it can also reveal how other factors such as depression, anxiety, and life stress influence cognitive functioning, memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress. Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology is described as the most sophisticated, state-of-the-art, real-time imaging/brain training available, enabling visualization of live activity in regions such as the Limbic system, anterior cingulate, fusiform gyrus, and Brodmann areas by recording 19 channels of brain activity simultaneously, with brain dysfunction having a variety of possible causes (encephalopathy) and associations with memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, and cognitive decline. DTI/MRI is described as diffusion tensor imaging—an MRI technique that uses anisotropic diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of the brain; fiber tractography (FT) is a 3D reconstruction method to assess neural tracts using DTI data. This non-invasive imaging tool is used to investigate white matter structure that may be damaged during a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) even in the absence of neurological symptoms.

Please reply with acceptance or denial of the requests. If testing is approved, please attach a Letter of Protection (LOP).

Brodmann areas, and more by recording 19 channels of brain activity
simultaneously. Brain dysfunction can have a variety of causes
(encephalopathy), memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog,
irritability, forgetfulness, cognitive decline.

DTI/MRI: Diffusion tensor imaging is an MRI technique that uses anisotropic
diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of the brain.
Fiber tractography (FT) is a 3D reconstruction technique to assess neural
tracts using data collected by diffusion tensor imaging. A non-invasive
medical imaging tool is used to investigate the structure of white matter
that is damaged during a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) without any
neurological symptoms

Please reply back accepting or denying requests. *Additionally, please
attach a LOP if testing is approved! *

On February 1, 2023, Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm forwarded an email titled MUHAMMED ALIF Brain Testing Approval to Aaron Whaley. The message, sent from Sarena’s address at sarena@whaleylawfirm.com, asked AW to approve the brain testing for MUHAMMED ALIF and included the Whaley Law Firm’s contact details: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note indicating a new email address.

The forwarded chain contains a message from Cutting Edge Admin dated January 31, 2023, addressed to MUHAMMED ALIF. It states that approval is being requested for traumatic brain injury (TBI) testing for MUHAMMED ALIF, who is a patient of Dr. William Hwang, MD, who is double board-certified in neurology and psychiatry and has specialty training in physical medicine, rehabilitation, and sleep disorders. Dr. Hwang recommends a battery of procedures including an oculomotor assessment, posturography, neurocognitive testing, brain mapping, and MRI/DTI prior to treatment, all intended to better identify traumatic brain injury.

The TBI testing battery includes the following components and costs: Oculomotor assessment ($2,000); Neurocognitive testing ($2,200); Posturography ($500); Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology ($8,000); and the DTI/MRI ($8,000). The message notes that additional information about how multifactorial testing can benefit the identification of brain injuries is available by visiting http://meet.ceostx.com to schedule a time to speak with Dr. Matt DeGaetano; if scheduling is difficult, or if there is a preference to speak with him directly, contact can be made at drmatt@ceostx.com.

Indications for the tests are detailed as follows: Oculomotor assessment is indicated for brain injury, headaches, fatigue, blurry vision, foggy thinking, reading difficulties, cognitive challenges, balance issues, trouble sleeping, mood changes, blurred vision, double vision, nausea, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensations, and lightheadedness. Posturography is indicated for brain injury, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensations, and lightheadedness. Neurocognitive testing can help determine the brain areas affected by a TBI and how these impairments impact day-to-day functioning, and it can also evaluate how other factors such as depression, anxiety, and life stress influence cognitive functioning, memory loss, concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress. Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology is described as the most sophisticated, state-of-the-art, real-time imaging/brain training available, allowing visualization of live activity in regions such as the Limbic system, anterior cingulate, fusiform gyrus, and Brodmann areas by recording 19 channels of brain activity simultaneously; brain dysfunction can have various causes (encephalopathy) and can manifest as memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, and cognitive decline. DTI/MRI is explained as diffusion tensor imaging, an MRI technique that uses anisotropic diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of the brain; fiber tractography is a 3D reconstruction technique to assess neural tracts using DTI data. It is a non-invasive medical imaging tool used to investigate white matter structure damaged during a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) even in the absence of neurological symptoms.

Please reply back with acceptance or denial of the testing requests, and attach a Letter of Protection (LOP) if testing is approved.

Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 concerns client Muhammad Alif. In an email thread dated January 31, 2023, Cutting Edge Admin requested approval for traumatic brain injury (TBI) testing for MUHAMMED ALIF, who is a patient of Dr. William Hwang, MD, described as double board-certified in neurology and psychiatry, with specialties in physical medicine, rehabilitation, and sleep disorders. Dr. Hwang recommended a testing battery including an oculomotor assessment, posturography, neurocognitive testing, brain mapping, and MRI/DTI prior to treatment in order to better identify a traumatic brain injury.

The requested TBI battery was itemized with the following components and fees: Oculomotor assessment for $2,000; Neurocognitive testing for $2,200; Posturography for $500; Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology for $8,000; and DTI/MRI for $8,000. Indications were provided for each test: the oculomotor assessment is indicated for brain injury symptoms such as headaches, fatigue, blurry or double vision, foggy thinking, reading difficulties, cognitive challenges, balance issues, trouble sleeping, mood changes, as well as blurred or nausea and dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensations, and lightheadedness. Posturography is indicated for brain injury with dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensations, and lightheadedness.

Neurocognitive testing was described as a means to determine the brain areas affected by TBI and how impairments impact day-to-day functioning, while also assessing how other factors such as depression, anxiety, and life stress influence cognitive functioning, memory, concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress. Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology were described as the most sophisticated, real-time imaging and brain training available, enabling visualization of live activity in regions including the Limbic system, anterior cingulate, fusiform gyrus, and Brodmann areas by recording 19 channels of brain activity simultaneously, with brain dysfunction potentially arising from various causes (encephalopathy) and presenting as memory loss, difficulty concentrating, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, and cognitive decline. DTI/MRI was explained as diffusion tensor imaging that uses anisotropic diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of the brain, with fiber tractography providing a 3D reconstruction to assess neural tracts, and described as a non-invasive imaging tool to investigate white matter damaged during TBI even in the absence of neurological symptoms. The request concluded with a directive to reply accepting or denying the requests and to attach a Letter of Protection (LOP) if testing is approved.

In response, on February 1, 2023, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, Louisville, KY, replied that the treatment had been approved by the attorney. She stated that the firm could not send a letter of protection or make agreements that may not be in the best interest of their client. However, she noted that the billing for the testing would be included in all damages presented for consideration at the time of negotiations. The message ended with an offer to provide further assistance and included her contact information: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line (D) 502-357-9971; office line (O) 502-583-4022 ext 104; email address Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note indicating this is a new email address. Signed by Sarena M. Tuttle, The Whaley Law Firm.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

A request for approval of traumatic brain injury (TBI) testing for MUHAMMED ALIF, a patient of Dr. William Hwang, MD, who is double board-certified in neurology and psychiatry with a specialty in physical medicine, rehab, and sleep disorders, was sent on January 31, 2023. The requester noted that Dr. Hwang recommends the following procedures prior to treatment: an oculomotor assessment, posturography, neurocognitive testing, brain mapping with electrophysiology, and diffusion tensor imaging MRI (DTI/MRI). The TBI testing battery was itemized with costs as follows: oculomotor assessment - $2,000; neurocognitive testing - $2,200; posturography (this battery) - $500; brain mapping and electrophysiology - $8,000; and DTI/MRI - $8,000. The materials indicated that the tests are performed to better identify traumatic brain injury.

The submission included a note directing the recipient to learn more about the benefits of multifactorial testing by scheduling a time to speak with Dr. Matt DeGaetano at http://meet.ceostx.com, or, if time is limited, to contact him directly at drmatt@ceostx.com. Indications associated with the tests were detailed as follows: for the oculomotor assessment, brain injury with headaches, fatigue, blurry vision, foggy thinking, reading difficulties, cognitive challenges, balance issues, trouble sleeping, mood changes, blurred or double vision, nausea, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensations, and lightheadedness; for posturography, brain injury with dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensations, and lightheadedness; for neurocognitive testing, a determination of the brain areas impacted by a TBI and how those impairments affect day-to-day functioning, including how factors such as depression, anxiety, and life stress influence cognitive functioning, memory loss, concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress; for brain mapping and electrophysiology, a description of this as the most sophisticated, real-time imaging/brain training available to visualize live activity in the limbic system and other regions by recording 19 channels of brain activity simultaneously, with brain dysfunction having multiple potential causes (encephalopathy), including memory loss, concentration difficulties, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, and cognitive decline; and for DTI/MRI, an explanation of diffusion tensor imaging as an MRI technique that uses anisotropic diffusion to estimate axonal (white matter) organization, including fiber tractography as a 3D reconstruction technique to assess neural tracts, a non-invasive imaging tool to investigate white matter structure damaged during a TBI in the absence of neurological symptoms. The submission concluded with a request to reply accepting or denying the requests and to attach a Letter of Protection (LOP) if testing is approved.

The email thread shows that on February 1, 2023 at 5:59 PM, Sarena M. Tuttle (The Whaley Law Firm) wrote to AW with the question, “Hey AW, This came in on Mo. Approve?” Sarena’s signature block appeared with her address at The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, phone numbers D: (502) 357-9971 and O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, and her new email address noted as Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com. The forwarded correspondence also includes the prior message from Cutting Edge Admin dated January 31, 2023 at 3:37 PM with the subject MUHAMMED ALIF Brain Testing Approval, addressed to MUHAMMED ALIF.

In response, on February 1, 2023 at 6:02 PM (Eastern Time), Aaron Whaley of the Whaley Law Firm replied, “Yes, approved.” The thread also contains an end-user signature block for Aaron Whaley, including his firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, and his phone number 502-583-4022.

The correspondence is part of the Muhammed-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 case, with client Muhammad Alif, and documents the approval of the proposed TBI testing and associated procedures, the proposed providers, the cost structure, the educational materials and contact avenues for follow-up, and the instruction to attach an LOP upon approval.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. Re: Uninsured motorist. Initial client contact occurred on February 6, 2023, when Muhammad Alif emailed Sarena Tuttle at The Whaley Law Firm from stimulus110@yahoo.com regarding uninsured motorist coverage in the motor vehicle accident case associated with the November 8, 2022 incident. In his message, he indicated that after speaking with his insurance company he does indeed have uninsured motorist coverage on his policy, and he requested policy limits for both of his automobile accident cases. He also noted that he would be leaving for the Mayo Clinic this Wednesday and stated that he is pursuing a civil suit against both drivers involved in the November 8 and December 9 accidents, insisting that the insurance company disclose policy limits. The email was sent from Yahoo Mail for iPad and was signed as “Mo Alif.”

On February 6, 2023, at 11:32:16 AM, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm replied to Muhammad Alif, cc’ing Aaron Whaley, at agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com. The response, sent from the firm at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, included the firm’s contact details: D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.” In her message, she acknowledged awareness of the available coverages under the client’s Farmers Policy. She explained that, as discussed previously, insurance companies are not required to disclose policy limits until a demand is submitted on the client’s behalf, and she could not force disclosure. She also sought clarification on what Muhammad meant by “following a civil suit,” stating she assumed he meant “filing” a civil suit and that she was not aware of his claims being sent to litigation at that time. She requested that he clarify who is filing the civil suit.

CC: Muhammad Alif [stimulus110@yahoo.com](mailto:stimulus110@yahoo.com)
Date: Mon, 6 Feb 2023 16:54:30 +0000 (UTC)

Good afternoon Serena,

 

I just want to clarify my medical treatment in regards to thetwo accidents in was involved in.

 

     On November 8, 2023 I was involved in my first accident andreceived treatment from Parkridge Medical Center. I have also received additionalfrom heath care from the following places as listed in the order below.

2nd Norton Health Care

3rd Cutting edge

4th Anointed hands

5th Mark Lynn

6th Kort Physical Therapy

All imaging has been done at Innovative Open MRI &Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Center in Lake Mary Florida. I have also received ConsultationAptiv. 

On Wednesday, February 8, 2023, I will be going to Mayo Clinicin Rod Chester, New York for more medical treatment.

Farmers Insurance is the insurance company for this accidentonly. All bills need to be sent to them for payment from the treatment centersabove. I’m also requesting policy limits immediately from Farmers.
     On December 9, 2023 I was in my second accident in New York.Where I was in a cab that was reared ended by another automobile. I have onlybeen seen by Cutting Edge and Starlite Chiropractor for medical treatment. Inregards to this accident I do have uninsured motorist insurance.I know this is a lot however, if you feel like all of thisis to much for you please let me know as soon as possible.

Muhamad Alif
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

In an email dated February 6, 2023, Nona Bacote wrote to Serena Tuttle and Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm, with Muhammad Alif cc’d, to clarify his medical treatment in relation to the two motor vehicle accidents in which he was involved.

According to the message, the first accident occurred on November 8, 2023, and he received treatment at Parkridge Medical Center. He also reports additional care from several healthcare providers in the following order: Norton Health Care, Cutting Edge, Anointed Hands, Mark Lynn, and Kort Physical Therapy. All imaging has been performed at Innovative Open MRI &Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Center in Lake Mary, Florida, and he has also received a ConsultationAptiv. On Wednesday, February 8, 2023, he is scheduled to go to Mayo Clinic in Rod Chester, New York for further medical treatment. Farmers Insurance is the insurance company for this accident only; all bills should be sent to them for payment from the treatment centers listed above. He is also requesting policy limits immediately from Farmers.

Regarding the second accident, on December 9, 2023 he was in a second accident in New York, where he was in a cab that was rear-ended by another automobile. He has only been seen for medical treatment by Cutting Edge and Starlite Chiropractor. For this second incident, he notes that he does have uninsured motorist insurance. He concludes by acknowledging that this is a lot of information and asks to be told if it is too much for the recipient to handle, requesting a prompt response if possible.

Sincerely,
Muhamad Alif

Re: Accidents

On February 6, 2023, Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm emailed Nona Bacote, with Aaron Whaley and Muhammad Alif copied, to confirm that all of the client’s providers had been documented and that the client had confirmed this repeatedly. She stated that all medical records and bills had been requested and were being awaited, and that providers have a minimum of 30 days to produce these documents. The client expressed a desire for policy limits and PIP to be released to Starlite. Sarena explained that insurance companies are not required to disclose policy limits prior to a demand, and a demand cannot be submitted until all medical bills and records are received. She also explained that Aaron typically reviews the medical bills before releasing PIP payments, as he determines who receives what portion of the available benefits. He cannot release all benefits to a single provider when there are multiple providers and roughly $30,000 outstanding between two of them. She advised that she had forwarded this information to him for review, along with the statement that a civil suit is being “following” or “filed” on the client’s behalf, and that he would reach out to discuss the matter further.

On the same date, February 6, 2023 at 11:54 AM, Nona Bacote replied to Serena to clarify the client’s medical treatment in relation to the two accidents.

She stated that in the first accident, on November 8, 2023, the client received treatment at Parkridge Medical Center and subsequently received additional care from the following providers, listed in the order below: Norton Health Care (2nd), Cutting Edge (3rd), Anointed Hands (4th), Mark Lynn (5th), and Kort Physical Therapy (6th). All imaging was performed at Innovative Open MRI & Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Center in Lake Mary, Florida, and the client also received a Consultation at Aptiv. On Wednesday, February 8, 2023, the client would be going to Mayo Clinic in Rod Chester, New York for additional medical treatment.

Farmers Insurance is identified as the insurer for this accident only. All bills should be sent to Farmers for payment from the treatment centers listed above, and the client is requesting policy limits immediately from Farmers.

Regarding the second accident, on December 9, 2023 the client was involved in a second accident in New York, where she was in a cab that was rear-ended by another automobile. She has only been seen for medical treatment by Cutting Edge and Starlite Chiropractor. For this accident, she has uninsured motorist insurance.

The client acknowledged that this is a lot of information and asked to be notified if it is too much to handle. The note is signed by Muhamad Alif.

In February 2023, the Whaley Law Firm pursued the medical records and billing for Mr. Alif. On February 2, 2023, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm—located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222 (D: 502-357-9971; O: 502-583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com; please note the new email address)—sent an email to MD Chiufang Hwang and others with the subject Muhammad Alif Medical Records & Billing Request. The body stated: “Good afternoon, Please find attached our office's request for any & all medical records and billing related to the above referenced client/patient, Mr. Muhammad Alif.”

The message was part of a chain in which Dr. Chiufang H. Hwang, MD responded that he did not handle medical records nor billing and directed the recipient to contact Cutting Edge at (214) 427-7227. His reply, dated February 2, 2023 at 2:49 PM, included his contact details: mobile 214-914-2955; emails mdchiufang@gmail.com and mdchiufang@aol.com; and a link to www.chiufang.com. The forwarded exchange also included the note: “Begin forwarded message: From: Sarena Tuttle Date: February 2, 2023 at 2:09:27 PM CST To: MDCHIUFANG@gmail.com Subject: Muhammad Alif Medical Records & Billing Request” with the content: “Good afternoon, Please find attached our office's request for any & all medical records and billing related to the above referenced client/patient, Mr. Muhammad Alif.” It also displayed Sarena’s full signature and the Whaley Law Firm contact details, including (PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).

Additionally, the thread shows that the Whaley Law Firm’s request originated with The Whaley Law Firm and that the Cutting Edge Records & Billing Department office was identified at 1401 E Trinity Mills Road, Carrollton, TX 75006, with P: (972) 978-2525, F: (972) 573-9779, and email addresses records@ceostx.com and scheduling@ceostx.com.

On February 3, 2023 at 3:23 PM, the Cutting Edge Front Desk sent a message related to the ongoing request, continuing the chain of communications about Muhammad Alif’s medical records and billing.

Finally, on February 6, 2023, at 09:30:04 Central Time, Maggie Gonzalez, of the Records & Billing Department at Cutting Edge Medical Services, sent an email to Sarena Tuttle and Mariela Cruz (mariela@ceostx.com), cc’ing Dr. Allen Starkey (drallen@ceostx.com). The subject was the Muhammad Alif medical records and billing request. Any questions please let me know. Thank you, Maggie Gonzalez.” The email referenced that attached documents included both medical records and a bill.
