In the Muhammad Alif motor vehicle accident case (case number Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022) with client Muhammad Alif, an email thread dated November 17, 2023, reflects ongoing discovery work at The Whaley Law Firm. The thread shows correspondence among The Whaley Law Firm staff, including Aaron Whaley and Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager. The subject line of the principal thread is “Re: Muhammad Alif 11/08/22.” The email was sent from Sarena Tuttle to Aaron Whaley, with Bryce Koon and Muhammad Alif cc’d, and includes Sarena’s new email address note. The Whaley Law Firm’s address is 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and the signatures list direct line D: (502) 357-9971, office line O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, and the email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

The thread begins with Sarena’s brief reply, “Will do!” followed by a series of internal messages about discovery. At 1:09 PM (time shown as “1:09?PM” in the record), Aaron Whaley wrote, “Send letter regarding late discovery responses.” Earlier in the day, at 9:29 PM (time notated as 9.29.2023 in the record), Sarena noted, “09.29.2023 - Email is in the Defense Counsel Correspondence - Actual Disc Req are in the Pleadings Folder.” Her signature block appears again with the firm’s contact information and the reminder “(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).”

The thread also contains a prior exchange from 12:26 PM, in which Aaron asked, “When was discovery served on Wickliffe?” And at 11:40 AM, Sarena responded, “Hey AW, We have Mo's Answers - Need Final Drafting Served Def WickCliffe - No Response Need to discuss Disc Req for Harbor House, if any.” This message also includes Sarena’s standard signature block.

Earlier still, at 10:43 AM, Aaron asked: “Have we filed our responses to interrogatories and RFPD? Do we have responses to our interrogatories? Have we confirmed our interrogatories were served if there has not been a response?” The thread closes with the recurring Whaley Law Firm signatures and contact details. 

In summary, the record documents ongoing discovery management on November 17, 2023, in Muhammad Alif’s MVA case, including plans to send a letter regarding late discovery responses, references to discovery that had been served or not served on Wickliffe/WickCliffe, and consideration of discovery requests for Harbor House, as well as inquiries into the status of interrogatories and requests for production. The communications involve Sarena M. Tuttle as the paralegal/case manager and Aaron Whaley, with formal addresses and contact information for the firm and Sarena’s note about a new email address.

Initial client contact on November 21, 2023, with Sarena regarding Muhammad Alif's motor vehicle accident case (Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022).

Details: We received the client’s response to the discovery request, and there were no answers. He placed an ‘X’ through all of the authorizations except the DC Medical Authorization. An attempt to call the client was made, but the call went straight to voicemail, and the voicemail is not set up. We sent an email to the client requesting that he stop by the office to correctly execute the authorizations and provide some type of answers to the interrogatories.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. The client is Muhammad Alif.

This note summarizes a series of follow-up emails between Aptiva Health and Whaley Law Firm regarding Muhammad Alif’s motor vehicle accident (MVA) case from November 8, 2022. The communications involve April Mullins, A/R Specialist / Lien Negotiator / Attorney Liaison at Aptiva Health, and Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm, with Sarena Tuttle cc’d on the exchanges. The emails include standard confidentiality disclaimers stating the messages are for the addressee only and may contain privileged information.

On June 27, 2023, April Mullins sent a message to Aaron and cc’d Sarena Tuttle, indicating she wanted to follow up on the status of Muhammad Alif’s case. She reported that Farmers advised Aptiva Health that Muhammad’s benefits are reserved and that he currently had an outstanding balance of $1,475 with the office. She also noted that she had included an itemization copy for Aaron’s review. In her signature block, Mullins identified herself as an A/R Specialist / Lien Negotiator / Attorney Liaison and provided her contact information: Office number 502-909-0772, mobile 502-428-1346, amullins@aptivahealth.com, aptivahealth.com, and the Louisville address 3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218. The message carried the standard confidentiality disclaimer.

The following day, June 28, 2023, Aaron Whaley replied that the matter was “Still in progress.” This response also carried the same disclaimer and signature blocks, including the Whaley Law Firm contact details: 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, phone 502-583-4022.

Earlier in the chain, there was a message from April Mullins on October 20, 2023, in which she again asked for the status of the case. Aaron Whaley replied later that day, at approximately 3:27 PM, with the note: “pending. Filed suit.” This exchange also included the standard confidentiality disclaimer and Mullins’s contact details, including her office address at that time: 3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218. Aaron’s reply was sent to Mullins with Sarena Tuttle cc’d and included the Whaley Law Firm address and phone.

The most recent item in the record is a follow-up from April Mullins dated January 23, 2024, titled “RE: Muhammad Alif MVA 11/8/22.” In this message, she addressed Aaron Whaley and reiterated the request for a status update on Muhammad Alif’s case. The email was sent from Mullins as the A/R Specialist / Lien Negotiator / Attorney Liaison, with the same confidentiality disclaimer present. The signature block in this message again lists Mullins’s contact information (Office: 502-909-0772; Cell: 502-428-1346; amullins@aptivahealth.com; aptivahealth.com) and the Louisville address 12300 Plantside Dr, Louisville, KY 40299, along with the other identifying details and the disclaimer.

Additionally, the record includes references to the Whaley Law Firm signatures in the messages, which show the firm’s address as 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, and the phone number 502-583-4022, reinforcing the participants and contact channels used throughout the exchanges.
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

The case file for Muhammad Alif’s motor vehicle accident (MVA) matter dated 11-08-2022 has been the subject of a long-running email thread between The Whaley Law Firm and Aptiva Health. In a message dated January 23, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, advised April Mullins that the claim is still in litigation. She noted that, once the firm reaches a point for settlement discussions, they will contact Aptiva Health to discuss any outstanding balances. Sarena also included that this is her new email address and provided her contact information and office details.

Earlier, on January 22, 2024, April Mullins—A/R Specialist / Lien Negotiator and Attorney Liaison for Aptiva Health—sent a follow-up email asking for the status of Muhammad Alif’s case. Her message was directed to Aaron Whaley and circulated with Sarena Tuttle. Mullins’ signature block listed her office and cell numbers, email address (amullins@aptivahealth.com), and Aptiva Health’s website (aptivahealth.com), with the office at 3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218. The message also carried Aptiva Health’s standard confidentiality disclaimer.

The thread’s chronology shows earlier communications from Aaron Whaley. On October 20, 2023, Aaron informed April that the matter was pending and that a suit had been filed. This was followed by a June 27, 2023 email from April Mullins, in which she stated that Farmers had advised their office that the beneficiary’s benefits were reserved, and that Muhammad Alif currently had a balance of $1,475 with the office. She also indicated that she had included a copy of his itemization for review. Aaron Whaley responded on June 28, 2023, noting that the matter was still in progress.

The email chain reflects the recipients and correspondence trail among The Whaley Law Firm, Aptiva Health, and the involved parties, with the case subject line repeatedly referencing Muhammad Alif MVA 11/8/22. The signatures show multiple contact points: Sarena Tuttle’s affiliation with The Whaley Law Firm at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222 (D) 502-357-9971, O 502-583-4022 ext 104, and email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, noting a new email address; and Aptiva Health’s details including office and cell numbers, and the Louisville address of 3615 Newburg Road (and 12300 Plantside Dr in earlier correspondence). The threads also include standard confidentiality notices on the sent emails, and a trailing signature line referencing AptivaHealth’s Twitter link.

The case is Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022, involving client Muhammad Alif, in the matter of Muhammad Alif v. Jacquelyn Wickliffe, et al. On February 20, 2024, an email was sent from Deborah Jackson (deborah.jackson@whtlaw.com) to Sarena Tuttle (sarena@whaleylawfirm.com) with several attorneys copied: agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com, bryce@whaleylawfirm.com, Max Smith (Max.Smith@whtlaw.com), and Kaylee Collins (kaylee.collins@whtlaw.com). The message, dated Tuesday, February 20, 2024 at 19:36:50 UTC, was sent from the Vine Center office located at 333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507.

In the body of the email, Deborah apologizes for the delay in providing dates for Ms. Wickliffe’s deposition in the above matter and notes that they would also like to schedule the Plaintiff’s deposition. She explains that there are multiple upcoming trials, so they are currently scheduling into late April. The dates available are April 29, April 30, May 1, May 2, May 6 through May 9, May 20 through May 24, and May 27 through May 30. Deborah requests that the recipient let her know if any of these dates work for their office and for Mr. Alif, after which they will confirm with Ms. Wickliffe. The email closes with “Thanks” and the sender’s signature.

The signature identifies Deborah Jackson as a Legal Assistant to George B. Hocker, Ashley K. Brown, Maxwell D. Smith, William J. Barker II, Jared M. Hudson, and Jeanette L. Jayne. The Vine Center’s contact details follow: 333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507; phone 859.422.6000; fax 859.422.6001; website www.whtlaw.com.

The email also includes a standard confidentiality notice stating that the information in the transmission is privileged and confidential. If you are not the intended recipient, you should not read, distribute, or reproduce the transmission or any attachments. If you received the message in error, you should delete it and notify the sender so that the records can be corrected.

In the email, Deborah stated that they could do May 23 and proposed a 10:00 a.m. start time for Mr. Alif’s deposition, with Ms. Wickliffe’s deposition to follow after work. Jayne, and provided the Vine Center address at 333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507, along with a phone number and fax. The following day, February 21, 2024, Sarena Tuttle replied. In her note to Deborah, with copies to agwhaley, bryce, Max Smith, and Kaylee Collins, Sarena said good morning and indicated that they also have a tentative trial on April 29, which is Derby Week, and a second tentative trial the week of May 6. She added that they could do May 21 through May 23 for deposition dates.

episodes.natural_language:
In the Muhammad Alif v. Jacquelyn Wickliffe, et al. case (Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022), the client is Muhammad Alif. The correspondence centers on scheduling depositions and possible trial dates, with coordination between The Whaley Law Firm in Louisville and Vine Center in Lexington.

On February 20, 2024, Deborah Jackson, a legal assistant at Vine Center (333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507; P: 859.422.6000; F: 859.422.6001; www.whtlaw.com), wrote to Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: 502-357-9971; O: 502-583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com) to propose dates for the deposition of Ms. Wickliffe and to begin scheduling Plaintiff’s deposition as well. Deborah listed the available dates as 4/29, 4/30, 5/1, 5/2, 5/6–5/9, 5/20–5/24, and 5/27–5/30, noting that they were scheduling into late April due to multiple upcoming trials.

The next day, February 21, 2024, Sarena replied that there were also tentative trial dates to consider: a trial on 4/29, which is Derby Week, and a second tentative trial the week of 5/6, with the possibility of trial dates on May 21–23. This message was signed by Sarena M. Tuttle as Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, reiterating her contact details and noting the email address as a new address (PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).

On February 22, 2024, Deborah responded again from Vine Center, stating that they could do May 23 and proposing a 10:00 a.m. start time for Mr. Alif’s deposition, with Ms. Wickliffe’s deposition to follow after work. She asked whether the notices should be sent to The Whaley Law Firm’s office or, alternatively, they could be held at Vine Center’s Louisville office. Deborah’s message included her firm’s standard confidentiality disclaimer.

Later that same day, February 22, 2024, Sarena replied: “Good afternoon Deborah, That sounds perfect. Yes, we would prefer to use your Louisville Office as all other parties are located in Louisville. I will get a notice for Mrs. Wickcliffe to you as soon as possible.” In this note, Sarena confirmed the preference for using the Louisville office and indicated she would prepare and send the notice for Wickliffe/Wickcliffe.

Throughout these exchanges, both sides included their standard email signatures and confidentiality notices. The Whaley Law Firm’s communications repeatedly referenced their Louisville office as the preferred location for notices, given that all other parties were located in Louisville, and Sarena indicated she would issue the notice for Ms. Wickliffe (also spelled Wickcliffe in one instance) promptly. The exchanges also highlighted the Derby Week context for the proposed 4/29 date and outlined multiple May dates and the specific 10:00 a.m. start for a May 23 deposition, with Wickliffe/Wickliffe’s deposition to follow after Mr. Alif’s.

episodes.natural_language:
In the case Muhammad Alif v. Jacquelyn Wickliffe, et al., Muhammad Alif is the client. In February 2024, the matter was being coordinated between The Whaley Law Firm and WHT Law to schedule depositions for Mr. Alif and for Ms. Wickliffe, with correspondence involving Sarena Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, and Deborah Jackson, a legal assistant at Vine Center’s WHT Law office.

On February 20, 2024, Deborah Jackson replied to Sarena Tuttle, apologizing for the delay and indicating that they would like to schedule the plaintiff’s deposition as well, noting that there were multiple upcoming trials and that they were scheduling into late April. Deborah provided available dates: April 29, April 30, May 1, May 2, May 6 through May 9, May 20 through May 24, and May 27 through May 30. She asked that Sarena let them know which dates would work for Mr. Alif and for Ms. Wickliffe so they could confirm with Ms. Wickliffe.

The next day, February 21, 2024, Sarena responded. She noted that there were tentative trials on April 29 (Derby Week) and a second tentative trial in the week of May 6, adding that they could do May 21–23.

Early on February 22, 2024, Deborah replied again, proposing that deposition for the plaintiff could be scheduled on May 23, with a start time of 10:00 a.m. for Mr. Alif, followed by Ms. Wickliffe’s deposition later in the day. Deborah asked whether these depositions should be noticed for The Whaley Law Firm’s Louisville office or if they should be held at WHT Law’s Louisville office.

Later on February 22, 2024, at 1:39 p.m., Sarena wrote back, agreeing with the arrangement. She stated that they would prefer to use the Louisville office since all other parties were located there, and she would send a notice for Mrs. Wickliffe as soon as possible.

Shortly after, at 1:55 p.m. (13:55:29 -0500) on the same day, Sarena sent another message, this time attaching the Notice to Take Deposition of Mrs. Wickcliffe, which she indicated would be filed momentarily. She added that if Deborah needed anything else, she should contact them directly to discuss further details. The message included Sarena’s full contact information: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office line 502-583-4022 ext. 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, noting the email as the new address. The email also carried the standard confidentiality notice and contact guidelines, including the reminder that the information is privileged and confidential and that, if not the intended recipient, the recipient should delete the message and notify the sender. The CC line listed agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com, bryce@whaleylawfirm.com, Max Smith (Max.Smith@whtlaw.com), and Kaylee Collins (kaylee.collins@whtlaw.com).

Throughout the exchange, the parties discussed coordinating the deposition schedule around upcoming trials, with the plan to conduct Mr. Alif’s deposition on May 23, 2024, at 10:00 a.m., and to have Ms. Wickliffe’s deposition follow later that day, and to notice the deposition for the Louisville office as requested. The communications also included standard protective language regarding email confidentiality and external email cautions.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

In the Muhammed Alif v. Jacquelyn Wickliffe, et al. matter, communications in late February 2024 revolved around scheduling and obtaining deposition notices for both the plaintiff, Muhammad Alif, and the defendant-witness, Mrs. Wickliffe. The exchange began with Deborah Jackson, a legal assistant with Vine Center/WHT Law in Lexington, Kentucky, sending an email on February 22, 2024 at 19:14:51 UTC to Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm. Deborah stated that she would be filing, momentarily, the Notice of Deposition for Mr. Alif and thanked Sarena for her help in getting the depositions scheduled. Deborah’s email also included the firm’s confidentially notice and signature block, which listed Vine Center’s address at 333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507, along with telephone and fax numbers and the firm’s website. The message noted that Deborah was the legal assistant to George B. Hocker, Ashley K. Brown, Maxwell D. Smith, William J. Barker, II, Jared M. Hudson, and Jeanette L. Jayne, and it contained an attached image reference.

Earlier on February 22, 2024, Sarena Tuttle replied at 1:55 PM, confirming that The Whaley Law Firm attached and would file the Notice to take the Deposition of Mrs. Wickliffe. She also encouraged Deborah to reach out if any further discussion was needed and provided her contact details, including her new email address. The same day, at 1:39 PM, Sarena followed up with a note that they preferred to use Deborah’s Louisville office since all other parties were located there, and she would obtain a deposition notice for Mrs. Wickliffe to be sent to Deborah as soon as possible.

Earlier still, Deborah had proposed a deposition date of May 23, 2024, with a 10:00 a.m. start time for Mr. Alif and Mrs. Wickliffe to follow after work, and she asked whether the depositions should be noticed for The Whaley Law Firm’s office or held at Vine Center’s Louisville office. This exchange occurred in an email from Deborah on February 22, 2024 at 8:31 AM. Deborah’s email also asked for confirmation about the preferred deposition venue and included the firm’s confidentially notice.

The scheduling conversation began a few days earlier. On February 21, 2024 at 10:04 AM, Sarena had written to Deborah (with copies to agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com, bryce@whaleylawfirm.com, Max Smith, and Kaylee Collins) about tentative trial dates: April 29 (Derby Week), a second tentative trial the week of May 6, and the possibility of May 21–23. Sarena’s message conveyed the broader context of trials that could affect deposition scheduling and provided her contact information.

Finally, on February 20, 2024 at 2:36 PM, Deborah responded to Sarena, apologizing for the delay in confirming dates for Mrs. Wickliffe’s deposition. She stated that they would also like to schedule the Plaintiff’s deposition and noted that due to multiple upcoming trials they were scheduling into late April. Deborah listed available dates: April 29, April 30, May 1, May 2, May 6–May 9, May 20–May 24, and May 27–May 30, and she asked Sarena to indicate which dates would work for The Whaley Law Firm, Mr. Alif, and Mrs. Wickliffe so they could proceed with confirmation.

Throughout these exchanges, the parties discussed using the Louisville office for notice and scheduling, coordinated notices for both depositions (Mr. Alif and Mrs. Wickliffe), and prepared the corresponding deposition notices to be filed. The communications included standard confidentiality notices and references to the involved offices and attorneys, with the Whaley Law Firm’s Louisville address listed as 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and Deborah’s firm communications referencing the Vine Center in Lexington, KY.

episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on March 26, 2024, with Sarena regarding Muhammad Alif in the Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 motor vehicle accident case. I received the client’s voicemail and returned the call; the client was starting to get nervous about the deposition.

During the conversation, we discussed that the deposition is a very simple process in which the defense asks questions about the accident, and I reviewed some of the standard deposition questions. The client appreciated the review. We briefly discussed the post-deposition process, including mediation, etc., and the client appreciated the explanation.

Bryce Koon, Esq., The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with phone number (502) 365-5043 and fax number (502) 364-9363. 

The message also carries a standard privilege disclaimer: “This electronic message is intended only for the named recipient. If you have received this message or any attachment in error, you are instructed to contact The Whaley Law Firm and advise in this regard, no waiver of any privilege shall be applicable, and you are instructed that you should not use the information contained herein or forward it to any third person not intended to receive it.”

On April 3, 2024, the Jefferson Circuit Court accepted a filing in the matter of Muhammad Alif v. Jacquelyn B. Wickcliffe et al., Case Number 23-CI-005509. The filing originated in the eFiling system as an NCP for the eFiler, with Envelope Number 7664700. The case caption reads: ALIF, MUHAMMAD VS. WICKCLIFFE, JACQUELYN B. ET AL. The filing was submitted by Aaron Gregory Whaley, attorney for the plaintiff. The circuit clerk’s notification confirms that the filing was processed and accepted at 11:16 AM Eastern on April 3, 2024. The notice was electronically mailed to Whaley, Aaron Gregory (agwhaley@WhaleyLawFirm.com), Maxwell Smith (max.smith@whtlaw.com), and Kaylee Collins (kaylee.collins@whtlaw.com).

A scheduled event associated with this filing is MOTION HOUR, set for April 15, 2024 at 11:45 AM Eastern. The event is to be held before Hon. Melissa Logan Bellows. The eFiling package included the document titled NOTICE OF SERVICE. Additional details for the filing are available via the Kentucky Court of Justice eFiling system at the dashboard receipt link (https://kcoj.kycourts.net/efiling/Dashboard/Receipt?caseid=7664700) and the package retrieval link (https://kcoj.kycourts.net/eFilingRetrieval/Home/Package?id=B40F87CE-5210-4AA7-9EDE-438C1E74E19C).

Discussed DC Assist VM & Conversation about downloading Client Cell Phone Contents & MTC Hearing Monday - Per BK Send Verification Page to Client - Object to Downloading Cell Phone - DC should SDT per proper procedure - Called DC Assist Kaley - LVM - Drafted & Sent Verification Page to Client via DocuSign - Sent Client Text Advising to check email & execute #Lit #DCSuppDiscReq #Verification
episodes.natural_language:
In the Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 case, the client is Muhammad Alif. The note records a discussion of the DC Assist voicemail and a conversation about downloading the client’s cell phone contents in relation to an MTC hearing scheduled for Monday.

Per BK, a Verification Page was sent to the client. The client objected to downloading the cell phone contents, and it was noted that DC should SDT per proper procedure. The team called DC Assist Kaley and left a voicemail. A Verification Page was drafted and sent to the client via DocuSign. A text message was sent to the client advising them to check their email and to execute the items labeled #Lit #DCSuppDiscReq #Verification.
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

In this case, on April 13, 2024, a DocuSign signature request from The Whaley Law Firm was sent regarding Muhammad Alif. The email was addressed to Aaron Whaley at STuttle.wlf@gmail.com, but the body began with “Hello Muhammad Alif,” and it stated that Muhammad Alif had opened and viewed the attached documents. At 6:55:40 AM PDT on 4/13/2024, Muhammad Alif opened and viewed the documents titled 2024.04.12 Alif Resp to DC Supp Disc Req - Verification Page.pdf. The message included a link to begin the signing process: https://na4.docusign.net/Member/EmailStart.aspx?m=3e1f2043-0318-4d96-8907-9fbfc79530eb, and it noted that if the link did not work, the recipient could highlight and copy the entire line and paste it into a browser to get started. The email also contained the line “No Content” following the document name.

This message was sent to Muhammad Alif by Aaron Whaley, who is using the DocuSign Electronic Signature Service. The email warned not to share the email, the link, or the access code with others. It provided options such as “Declining to sign” and “Managing notifications.” If there were questions about the document or if the document needed modification, the recipient was advised to contact the sender directly by email. The message also offered the option to stop receiving this email and included a long link to report abuse. For signing assistance, the email directed the recipient to the Help with Signing page in the DocuSign Support Center and included a separate link to basic signing guidance.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

On Monday, April 15, 2024, a series of email messages discussed the verification page and the client’s e-signature. Earlier in the morning, at approximately 9:18 AM, Bryce Koon asked whether we had obtained Muhammad Alif’s e-signature for the verification page. In a follow-up at 9:23 AM, Sarena M. Tuttle replied that Muhammad “viewed it but I do not see he completed it.” 

At roughly 9:24 AM, Bryce asked Sarena to follow up, noting that the motion hour was at 11:45 and expressing a desire to have the verification page with him when he goes. Later that day, at 9:34:38 AM, Sarena responded: “I just got off the phone with him. He will get it executed.” 

Signature details accompanying Sarena’s messages identify her as a Litigation Paralegal and Workers' Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and contact numbers D: (502) 357-9971 and O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104. Her email is listed as Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.” The email thread also shows the To field listing Bryce Koon at bryce@whaleylawfirm.com and CC to MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, and the subject line “Re: Verification Page.”

He also confirmed the deposition on May 23, and stated he is bringing two additional lawyers with him. He stated he wants $800,000.00. He also mentioned he is a 'surgical candidate' for neck surgery. He requested that we send an updated medical provider list including the surgeon's name and contact information. The client expressed understanding.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. The client is Muhammad Alif, and the file concerns a motor vehicle accident that occurred on November 8, 2022. The following narrative summarizes the email exchanges between Aptiva Health and The Whaley Law Firm regarding the case, its litigation status, and any outstanding balances, from mid-2023 through January 2024.

On June 27, 2023, April Mullins, A/R Specialist / Lien Negotiator and Attorney Liaison at Aptiva Health, wrote to Aaron Whaley (and copied Sarena Tuttle) noting that Farmers advised their office that the client’s benefits are reserved and that Muhammad Alif currently has a balance of $1,475 with Aptiva Health. She also mentioned that a copy of his itemization had been included for review. In her signature she identified her role, provided contact information (Office: 502-909-0772; Cell: 502-428-1346; amullins@aptivahealth.com; aptivahealth.com), and listed the office address as 3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218. A confidentiality disclaimer was attached to the email.

The following day, June 28, 2023, Aaron Whaley replied, stating simply, “Still in progress,” and he cc’d Sarena Tuttle. The email signature for Aaron and the chain shown his affiliation with The Whaley Law Firm, which is located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and included contact numbers.

On October 20, 2023, two related messages were exchanged. At 3:01 PM, April Mullins sent: “Good Evening I just wanted to follow up on the status of his case. Thank you,” reiterating her role and contact details (Office 502-909-0772; Cell 502-428-1346; amullins@aptivahealth.com; aptivahealth.com; 3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218). A confidentiality disclaimer was again included.

Later that same afternoon, at 3:27 PM, Aaron Whaley responded: “pending. Filed suit.” He had been copied on the prior message and again referenced in the thread along with Sarena Tuttle.

Moving forward, on January 23, 2024, the thread shows further activity. On January 22, 2024 at 9:29 PM (as shown in the record), April Mullins sent another follow-up message to Aaron, again stating, “Good Evening Aaron I just wanted to follow up on the status of his case,” and including her standard signature block and confidentiality notice.

On January 23, 2024, at 9:43 AM, Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm (address: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Direct: 502-357-9971; Office: 502-583-4022 ext 104; Email: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com; note: this is a new email address), replied to April. Her message stated: “Good morning April, This claim is still in litigation. Once we get to a point of settlement discussions, our office will reach out to discuss any outstanding balances.” The message carried a confidentiality disclaimer and signature blocks for both Sarena and Aaron Whaley.

Throughout the thread, the emails include standard confidentiality notices indicating that the messages and any attachments are intended only for the named recipients and may contain legally privileged or confidential information. The correspondence reflects ongoing efforts to monitor litigation status, discuss settlement discussions when they arise, and address any outstanding balances related to the case. The family of signatures shows varying office addresses over time for Aptiva Health (including 3615 Newburg Road and 12300 Plantside Drive, Louisville, KY, 40299) and The Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222), with associated telephone numbers and email addresses.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

Re: Muhammad Alif MVA 11/8/22. Over the period reflected in the email chain, the matter remained active and primarily litigated, with routine status updates exchanged between The Whaley Law Firm and Aptiva Health.

On June 27, 2023, April Mullins, acting as A/R Specialist / Lien Negotiator and Attorney Liaison for Aptiva Health, wrote to provide an update on the status of Muhammad Alif’s case. She noted that Farmers had advised that Mr. Alif’s benefits were reserved and that he currently carried a balance of $1,475 with Aptiva Health. She also stated that a copy of his itemization had been included for review. The signature block shows Mullins’ title and contact information: Office 502-909-0772; Cell 502-428-1346; amullins@aptivahealth.com; aptivahealth.com; and the Louisville address listed as 3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218.

The following day, June 28, 2023, Aaron Whaley replied, indicating simply that the matter was “Still in progress.”

On October 20, 2023, Aaron Whaley sent a brief update stating the case was “pending” and that a suit had been filed. Later that same day, October 20, 2023, at 3:01 PM, April Mullins sent a follow-up message to Aaron Whaley addressing the status of the case. Her signature block lists her titles again and provides Aptiva Health’s contact details: Office 502-909-0772; Cell 502-428-1346; amullins@aptivahealth.com; aptivahealth.com; with the Louisville addresses included as 3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218 (in this message) and the later sign-off showing 12300 Plantside Dr, Louisville, KY 40299 (in others).

Jumping forward to January 2024, Mullins again followed up with April 12 and then January 22–23. On January 22, 2024 at 9:29 PM, Mullins wrote to Aaron Whaley asking for an update on the case's status. Her signature once again listed her role as A/R Specialist / Lien Negotiator and Attorney Liaison, with her contact details: Office 502-909-0772; Cell 502-428-1346; amullins@aptivahealth.com; aptivahealth.com; and the address 12300 Plantside Dr, Louisville, KY 40299 (the signature also contains the earlier address variants). 

On January 23, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle, the Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, replied to Mullins. She stated that the claim was still in litigation and that once the office reached the point of settlement discussions, they would reach out to discuss any outstanding balances. Tuttle’s signature block includes her title, affiliation, and contact information: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com; and a note to use the new email address.

Following these January exchanges, Mullins sent another follow-up on April 12, 2024 at 4:57 PM, asking for an update on the case’s status. Her email, like the others, carried Aptiva Health’s confidentiality disclaimer, noting that the message and any attachments were intended only for the addressees and may contain legally privileged or confidential information.

Finally, on April 15, 2024, at 10:23:04 AM (Eastern Time), Sarena M. Tuttle responded that the claim remained in litigation and that depositions were scheduled for May 23, 2024. She added that it was unlikely there would be significant movement before June 23, 3024, and she promised to reach out with an update if anything new occurred prior to that date. Tuttle’s contact details were included in her signature, consistent with prior messages.

In summary, from mid-2023 through April 2024, Muhammad Alif’s motor vehicle accident claim remained in litigation. A deposition was scheduled for May 23, 2024, and, at least as of April 15, 2024, no significant movement was expected before June 23, 3024. The parties involved in the communications included Sarena M. Tuttle (The Whaley Law Firm), April Mullins (Aptiva Health), and Aaron Whaley (Whaley Law Firm), with multiple email exchanges regarding case status, outstanding balances, and settlement discussions.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. On April 15, 2024, The Whaley Law Firm exchanged a brief series of emails about a Verification Page for Muhammad Alif, the motor vehicle accident case opened on November 8, 2022. The thread’s subject was “Re: Verification Page,” and the emails were sent between Sarena Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager, and Bryce Koon, with Muhammad Alif cc’d at MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com.

In the early morning of April 15, 2024, Bryce Koon asked whether the client’s e-signature for the verification page had been obtained, writing: “Did we ever get his e-signature for the verification page?” A few minutes later, at approximately 9:23 AM, Sarena M. Tuttle replied that the client had viewed the verification page but had not completed it: “He viewed it but I do not see he completed it.” Bryce then followed up again around 9:24 AM, stating, “Will you follow up on that please? Motion hour is at 11:45 and I’d really like to have it with me when I go.” Later, at about 9:34 AM, Sarena responded: “I just got off the phone with him. He will get it executed.”

Later that same day, at 11:18 AM (Mon, Apr 15, 2024), Sarena sent the Verification Page with the subject line “Re: Verification Page” and included the message simply: “Here you go.” The email was sent from Sarena Tuttle to Bryce Koon, with Muhammad Alif’s file coordinated by MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com CC’d, and the page attached or included with the message.

Sarena M. Tuttle’s contact details appear in her signature: Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Direct line: (502) 357-9971; Office: (502) 583-4022 ext. 104; Email: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note indicating a new email address.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

On Monday, April 15, 2024, the Whaley Law Firm exchanged a series of emails about a Verification Page in Muhammad Alif’s workers’ compensation matter. The thread began with Bryce Koon asking, in a message originally sent by him and dated around 9:18 AM, whether the client’s e-signature had been obtained for the verification page. A follow-up note at about 9:24 AM from Bryce added that he would appreciate having the completed document for a motion later that day, since the motion hearing was at 11:45 AM. The message was copycc’d to MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com.

Earlier in the thread, at approximately 9:23 AM, Sarena Tuttle replied that Muhammad Alif had viewed the verification page but that she did not see where it had been completed. In a subsequent message, around 9:34 AM, Sarena wrote that she had just spoken with him and that he would get the page executed. Later, at about 11:18 AM, Sarena sent the page with the note “Here you go.” The topmost email in the chain, sent from Sarena at 11:22:11 AM -0400, included the line “Sorry, the stamp did not save.” and contained Sarena’s signature and contact details, noting the new email address. The chain’s signatures indicate Sarena M. Tuttle as Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with the phone numbers and email address listed, and a reminder to use her new email address. The thread also shows that the Verification Page was CC’d to MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com.

In April 2024, a series of email exchanges transpired between counsel at The Whaley Law Firm and the law firm Vine Center regarding discovery documents and a signed medical authorization. On April 15, 2024, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email to Max Smith and Kaylee Collins (copied to Sarena Tuttle and Deborah Jackson) with the subject Muhammad Alif v. Jacquelyn Wickliffe, et al. (Jefferson Circuit 23-CI-005509). The email attached the Discovery Verification page for Mr. Alif and stated that if anything else was needed, the sender should be notified. The message was signed by Bryce Koon and included The Whaley Law Firm’s contact information and a standard attorney-client privilege disclaimer.

On April 18, 2024, Kaylee Collins, Associate Attorney at Vine Center, replied to Bryce Koon and Max Smith. In her message, she thanked Bryce and explained that in Mr. Alif’s responses to their written discovery requests, specifically Request for Production of Documents (RFPD) No. 8 requesting a signed medical authorization, the response indicated “see attached.” She could not locate a signed medical authorization in the document production and asked that it be resent at their earliest convenience, noting she could be overlooking it.

The following day, April 19, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, replied to Kaylee Collins. She stated that the Executed Medical Authorization should have been returned to Kaylee Collins with the original set of discovery responses and she attached a copy for Kaylee’s records. Sarena’s message included her contact information and her updated email address, and she signed as The Whaley Law Firm’s Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Her direct dial number was (502) 357-9971, her office number (502) 583-4022 ext. 104, and her email was Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com. The email also carried the note indicating the new email address.

Throughout these exchanges, the parties referenced the same case and court matter, and the communications centered on the provision and verification of discovery materials, including the signed medical authorization and the Discovery Verification page.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. In May 2024, the Whaley Law Firm team corresponded regarding Muhammad Alif’s 11/8/22 motor vehicle accident, focusing on the defense’s production responses and missing insurance documents.

On May 9, 2024, at approximately 3:15 PM, Aaron Whaley wrote that the defense had answered the Interrogatories to the Responding Party and the Requests for Production of Documents. He noted that the defense’s answer regarding insurance referenced an attached DEC page, but he could not find that DEC page in their responses and asked whether they had the DEC page.

The following day, May 10, 2024, at 10:57:28 AM, Aaron Whaley sent a message to Sarena Tuttle with the subject “Re: Muhammad Alif 11/8/22 accident.” He described the message as a simple letter request, stating that since the defense had said the DEC page was included, it was likely an oversight. The email was cc’d to Bryce Koon, Muhammad Alif at muhammadalifz2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, and Muhammad Alif himself, with the sender listed as Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, 502-583-4022.

Earlier that same day, at about 10:35 AM, Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, replied. She indicated that she had reviewed a 189-page production and that it appeared to be entirely employee-related. She noted that she did not see a company insurance policy or declarations page and asked whether Aaron preferred a simple request for the missing documents or a formal supplemental request. Her signature block listed her role, firm, address, direct line, office line with extension 104, and her new email address, Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.
episodes.author: Aaron Whaley

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

Re: Muhammad Alif 11/8/22 accident. On May 9–10, 2024, the Whaley Law Firm team conducted internal communications regarding discovery in the Muhammad Alif 11/8/22 accident case. The thread began with an email from Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, to Aaron Whaley (and copied to Bryce Koon and Muhammad Alif) regarding the status of discovery materials for the case. In that thread, Sarena’s initial note indicated she would proceed with the requested action.

Earlier on May 9, 2024, at 3:15 PM, Aaron Whaley wrote that the defense had answered their IROG and RFPD, and that the defense’s response referenced an attached DEC page. He noted that he did not see that DEC page in their responses and asked whether they had the DEC page.

On May 10, 2024, at 10:35 AM, Sarena Tuttle responded. She stated that she had reviewed a 189-page production and that it appears to be all employee-related. She also noted that she did not see a company insurance policy/DEC page and asked whether they should simply request it or formally send Supplemental Requests.

At 10:57 AM on May 10, 2024, Aaron Whaley replied: “simple letter requesting since they said it was included. I assume it is an oversight.”

At 11:49 AM on May 10, 2024, Sarena Tuttle replied: “Got it. Will do.”

Signatures accompanying the messages show the following contact details and roles:

- Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).

- Aaron Whaley, Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222; 502-583-4022.

This thread reflects the team’s ongoing effort to obtain the DEC page referenced in the defense’s responses to discovery requests (IROG and RFPD) and to determine whether the DEC page was included or should be formally requested as part of supplemental discovery.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. This matter is identified as Muhammad Alif v Jacqueline Wickcliffe, Jeff Division 7, 23-CI-005509.

The note documents a sequence of email communications regarding the case, beginning with a May 10, 2024 exchange in which The Whaley Law Firm’s Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager, and Kaylee Collins of Vine Center exchanged information about discovery materials related to the plaintiff’s case.

On May 10, 2024, at 11:55 AM, Sarena M. Tuttle sent an email to Max Smith, Kaylee Collins, and Deborah Jackson, with Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon CC’d. The subject line was Muhammad Alif v Jacqueline Wickcliffe - Jeff Div 7 23-CI-005509. In the body of the message, Sarena explained that, during a deeper review of the Responses to Plaintiff Alif’s Discovery Request, the Response to RFPD No. 16 claimed that a Declaration Page was attached. However, after reviewing 189 pages, she and her team could not locate any information related to the defendants’ insurance policies and/or declaration pages. She requested that Kaylee Collins forward any and all documents that were missing from the responses up to and including the insurance policies and declaration pages relevant to the subject accident. The message concluded with Sarena’s contact details: Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, D: (502) 357-9971, O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and a note that this is her new email address. The email also carried the standard external email caution noting not to read, distribute, or reproduce if not the intended recipient, and to delete and notify the sender if received in error.

Earlier that same day, at about 3:36 PM, Kaylee Collins, Associate Attorney at Vine Center, replied to Sarena with the line: “Please see attached policy & dec page.” Kaylee’s email signature identified her as an Associate Attorney at Vine Center, located at 333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507, with a telephone number P: 859.422.6000 and a fax number F: 859.422.6001. She also included Vine Center’s website, www.whtlaw.com, and a confidentiality notice asserting that the information in the email transmission is privileged and confidential. The notice instructed that if the recipient is not the intended person, they should not read, distribute, or reproduce the transmission or attachments; if received in error, they should delete the email and notify the sender so records can be corrected. The message also reiterated Kaylee’s new email address and included the standard external email caution.

On May 13, 2024, at 09:47:37 -0400, Sarena M. Tuttle replied to Kaylee Collins with the simple acknowledgment: “Received, thank you so much Kaylee.” Sarena’s signature block followed, again listing her name, title, and contact information (Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com) and including the note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS” along with the standard external email warning.

In summary, the observed communications reflect a May 10, 2024 exchange addressing a gap in the discovery responses related to insurance policy information and declaration pages. Sarena requested all missing documents, and Kaylee responded the same day with a notice that the policy and declaration page were attached. Acknowledgment of receipt from Sarena followed on May 13, 2024.

In the body, Kaylee asked Sarena to “Please see attached policy & dec page.” The email was signed by Kaylee Collins, Associate Attorney, and included Kaylee’s signature block and the firm’s contact information, along with an image attachment reference. The firm’s address listed was Vine Center, 333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507, with a phone number and a fax number provided, and the website www.whtlaw.com. The message included a standard privilege and confidentiality notice stating that information in the email transmission is privileged and confidential, and instructions for unintended recipients to delete and notify the sender.

Earlier that same day, at 11:55 a.m., Sarena M. Tuttle sent a reply to Max Smith, Kaylee Collins, and Deborah Jackson, with Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon CC’d. In the email, Sarena indicated that, in a deeper review of the Responses to Plaintiff Alif’s Discovery Request, the Response to RFPD No. 16 stated that a Declaration Page had been attached. However, after reviewing the 189 pages, she could not locate any information related to the defendants’ insurance policies or declaration pages. She requested that Kaylee Collins forward any and all documents that were missing from the responses, up to and including the insurance policies and declaration pages relevant to the subject accident.

Sarena’s message was signed with her title, “Litigation Paralegal & Workers' Compensation Case Manager,” and identified The Whaley Law Firm as the firm. Her contact details were provided: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line (502) 357-9971; main line (502) 583-4022 ext. 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note indicating a new email address. The email also carried a caution note about external emails and attachments.

Client: Muhammad Alif

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Recvd Client Call - Asking about Deposition on Thursday - Advised 10am - DC Office - He asked about possibly settlement offers at depo - Advised that is highly unlikely as Depositions are still considered Fact Finding - Client reiterated the he will have 2 additional Attorneys present - Lacy T. Smith & Harry O'Donnell - Advised Client again that there is an ethical conundrum with other attorneys being involved - Attorneys should not be speaking to a Represented Individual without the presence of their Retained Attorney - Advised it is likely Mrs. Smith & Mr. O'Donnell will be asked to remain in the hallway & to not be upset if this happens - Discussed with Client depo Dos & Donts - Keep answers short & sweet - Yes, No Answers only when possible - Explained the more you speak, the more they can twist - Client expressed understand & awaiting Depo Conference tomorrow - Client advised he will be flying back from Atlanta tomorrow - Will head to Airport about Noon & will land around 4:30p - Requested Depo Conference prior to Noon 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: May 21 2024
episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on May 21, 2024 with Muhammad Alif, the client in the motor vehicle accident case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022.

Mr. Alif called to inquire about a deposition scheduled for Thursday at 10:00 a.m. at the DC Office. He asked about possible settlement offers at the deposition and was advised that settlement offers at the deposition are highly unlikely, as depositions are still considered fact-finding. He stated that he would have two additional attorneys present: Lacy T. Smith and Harry O'Donnell. He was advised that there is an ethical conundrum with other attorneys being involved, and that attorneys should not speak to a represented individual without the presence of their retained attorney. It was explained that Mrs. Smith and Mr. O'Donnell will likely be asked to remain in the hallway, and he should not be upset if that occurs. Deposition dos and don'ts were discussed: keep answers short and sweet, with yes/no answers only when possible, because the more you speak, the more they can twist. The client expressed understanding and indicated he is awaiting the Deposition Conference tomorrow. He also advised that he will be flying back from Atlanta tomorrow, will head to the airport at about noon, and is expected to land around 4:30 p.m. He requested the Deposition Conference prior to noon.

This contact was made by Sarena on May 21, 2024.

In the Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 case, involving client Muhammad Alif, there were a series of emails in May and June 2024 concerning spelling confirmations for the deposition transcript of Mr. Alif.

On May 23, 2024, at 3:43:07 PM, Beth Goodwin of Kentuckiana Court Reporters emailed Bryce Koon of The Whaley Law Firm, asking him to provide Mr. Alif with a list of spellings to verify for transcript accuracy. The list of names and terms to verify included: Felicia Thurman; Renee Castille; Tyreen Rivers; Muhammad Stevens; Tamara Stevens; Mariah Stevens; Rosalind Grant; Hattie Jordan; Casey Martin; Robert Jordan; Sterling Jordan; Richard Martin; Jabari Jordan; Michael Martin; Marvin Martin; Teresa Edlin; Tamar Peters; Tamita Peters; Sonya Parker; Janet Roberts; Planit Marketing; Nick Burrs; Adolf Rico; William - cousin; Star - friend; Dr. William Wang; Dr. Chris - seen for sleep study; Jody Winn; Jeff Chandler; Orlando Moore; Donald Bradley; Michael Norman; Harry O'Donnell; Gasheen Razzo; Always Going - broodmare. The message included the standard signature for Kentuckiana Court Reporters with the firm’s contact information and a confidentiality disclaimer.

Beth followed up again on May 28, 2024 at 8:35 AM, writing that she was checking whether Mr. Alid (a likely typographical variant of Alif) was able to provide these spellings for the transcript’s accuracy. This message also carried Beth Goodwin’s signature block for Kentuckiana Court Reporters.

On June 4, 2024, at 11:32:30 AM, Bryce Koon responded to Beth. He stated that he had gone through the list with Mr. Alif and that the spellings were generally accurate, adding: “Only ones we noticed were: Planet MarketingNick BurressJody WynnTamika Peters.” The message included Bryce’s professional signature for The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, along with a phone number (502) 365-5043 and a fax number (502) 364-9363. It also contained the confidentiality disclaimer typical of electronic communications from The Whaley Law Firm: that the message is intended only for the named recipient and may contain attorney-client privileged or otherwise protected information, and instructions not to share the content if received in error.

Across these exchanges, the communication chain included the following signatures and contact details:
- From The Whaley Law Firm: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Phone: (502) 365-5043; Fax: (502) 364-9363; Bryce Koon, Esq. 
- From Kentuckiana Court Reporters: Beth Goodwin, Court Reporter & Legal Videographer, 730 West Main Street, Suite 101, Louisville, KY 40202; Phone: (502) 589-2273; Fax: (502) 584-0119; Email: Beth@kentuckianareporters.com; with a reminder to schedule next depositions and a link to the Online Remote Deposition Guide.

Additionally, Beth Goodwin’s May 28 and May 23 messages included her role and firm details, reiterating the court reporting and videography services she provides, and the same statutory scheduling notice and online deposition guide link found in her signatures.

Client: Muhammad Alif

In the matter of a new appointment request for Muhammad Alif, born 04/16/1961, communications occurred between The Whaley Law Firm and Aptiva Health in July 2024. On Friday, July 12, 2024 at 09:31:33 a.m. Eastern Time, Sarena M. Tuttle, listed as Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, wrote to April Mullins of Aptiva Health. The subject was “Re: New Appointment Request for Muhammad Alif DOB 04/16/1961.” In her message, Sarena stated, “Thank you so much April. Let’s do a lien for now and I will review his records and get with Aaron on whether his neck injury is related to the 1st or 2nd MVA.” She signed with her full contact details, noting a new email address: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, along with the firm’s address in Louisville, KY and direct lines.

Earlier in the thread, on Thursday, July 11, 2024, there were two related exchanges. At approximately 3:27 p.m., Sarena sent a message to April with a summary of Mr. Alif’s situation. She explained that Mr. Alif had called requesting assistance to arrange an appointment to examine his cervical spine. He had been involved in a motor vehicle accident on 11/08/2022 and a second one on 12/09/2022, and he reported ongoing pain in his cervical area. He described the pain as beginning on the left side of his neck and traveling down beneath his shoulder blade, a pattern that has made it difficult for him to find a comfortable sleep position. Mr. Alif was out of town until Monday and wished to be seen as soon as possible upon his return, requesting that scheduling staff contact them to discuss and arrange an appointment for Mr. Alif on or about Tuesday, July 16, 2024. The message was signed by Sarena M. Tuttle, with the same firm contact details as above.

In response, on the same day, July 11, 2024, at about 10:21 p.m., April Mullins replied to Sarena. April is an A/R Specialist and Lien Negotiator, serving as Attorney Liaison. Her message suggested that they could reach out to Mr. Alif to schedule a follow-up under the second MVA and asked whether American Transit remained on file, or whether Mr. Alif would need to be seen on a lien or through health coverage.

The following day, July 12, 2024, Sarena replied to April’s thread. She stated, “Let's do a lien for now and I will review his records and get with Aaron on whether his neck injury is related to the 1st or 2nd MVA.” Her signature block appeared again with The Whaley Law Firm’s address and the updated email address, noting to contact her at Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com. The correspondence line included the firm’s contact numbers: D: (502) 357-9971 and O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104.

On July 30, 2024, in the motor vehicle accident case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 for client Muhammad Alif, an email thread about trial scheduling circulated within The Whaley Law Firm. The subject line was “Re: Alif.” The chain begins with an 11:44? AM message from Aaron Whaley to Sarena Tuttle, directing, “Please go ahead and file the motion for trial date and put on for Monday August 12 motion hour.” Aaron’s signature identifies him as with The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, with the firm’s phone numbers listed.

Earlier in the same thread, at approximately 11:53? AM, Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal & Workers' Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, replied: “Please review the attached NMO for Trial Date for approval prior to filing with the Jefferson County Circuit Court Division 7.” Her message includes her contact details in the signature, including her direct and office numbers and the note “(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).”

At 11:56:08 -0400, Aaron Whaley responded: “Looks good, thank you.” This reply was sent to Sarena Tuttle and cc’d to Muhammad Alif and Bryce Koon; the CC line shows Muhammad Alif’s louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com address and Bryce Koon’s address. The thread, including the subject line “Re: Alif,” reflects the sequence of actions: an instruction to file the motion for trial date, a directive to review the attached NMO for Trial Date prior to filing with Jefferson County Circuit Court Division 7, and a final confirmation that the review was satisfactory.

episodes.natural_language: Initial client contact on July 30, 2024, with Muhammad Alif regarding the motor vehicle accident case MVA-11-08-2022. The contact was made by Sarena, who reported that AW’s second email about filing the NMO PTC and the trial date had been received, and that BK is on vacation. The client has been calling about this matter. The NMO PTC filing was drafted and filed, and the matter is set for August 12, 2024 at 11:45 a.m. via telephonic conference. An update call to the client was attempted, but the line went straight to voicemail, and the voicemail is not set up.

__Denial & Re-process__
From: "Lee, Lauren S." [Lee.Lauren@mayo.edu](mailto:Lee.Lauren@mayo.edu)
To: "Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com" [Sarena@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:Sarena@whaleylawfirm.com)
CC: 
Date: Tue, 13 Aug 2024 17:33:22 +0000

Hi there,

I apologize for the delayed outreach; I unfortunately had a death in the family and have been out of the office intermittently.

One of our associates explained that you received a correspondence rejection letter for patient M. Alif. We are going to reopen this request, as it seems that we would be able to process dates of service 11/8/21-1/18/23. This is up to the date of the signature. If records are needed past the date of signature, we would need an updated authorization to say something along the lines of "I authorize any past, present, or future visits until authorization expires" or "I authorize the release of records created after the date of signature".

I hope this helps to clarify. If you end up receiving a revised authorization, please feel free to send this request to me directly for importing & processing.

If you have any questions, please let me know.

Thank you,

Lauren S. Lee, CRIS
Authorized Mayo Clinic Contractor

Verisma
Director, Client Operations
Direct Phone: 904-999-4037
Customer Service: 507-242-0145
lee.lauren@mayo.edu
episodes.natural_language:
Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 involves client Muhammad Alif. On August 13, 2024, at 17:33:22 UTC, Lauren S. Lee of Mayo Clinic emailed Sarena at Whaley Law Firm to apologize for the delayed outreach, citing a death in the family and intermittent time out of the office. She explains that an associate indicated you had received a correspondence rejection letter for patient M. Alif. Mayo Clinic intends to reopen the request, as they believe they can process dates of service from 11/8/21 through 1/18/23, up to the date of the signature. If records are needed past the date of signature, an updated authorization is required stating, for example, "I authorize any past, present, or future visits until authorization expires" or "I authorize the release of records created after the date of signature."

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. On August 13, 2024, in an email titled Re: Denial & Re-process, Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, wrote to Lauren S. Lee of Mayo Clinic (Verisma). The message requested that the Updated Certified Medical Records & Billing Request, with an Authorization signed and dated that day, be sent and that our office receive all medical records and billing from November 8, 2021 through today’s date, including records from any and all departments and locations. Sarena provided the firm’s contact details: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and she noted a NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.

Earlier that day, at about 1:33 PM (listed as 1:33?PM in the chain), Lauren S. Lee, CRIS, an Authorized Mayo Clinic Contractor with Verisma and the Director of Client Operations, replied. In her message, she apologized for the delayed outreach, noting she had a death in the family and had been out of the office intermittently. She explained that one of their associates indicated that a correspondence rejection letter had been received for patient M. Alif, and that they would reopen the request, since they would be able to process dates of service from 11/8/21 to 1/18/23, up to the date of the signature. She added that if records were needed past the date of signature, an updated authorization would be required to state either: "I authorize any past, present, or future visits until authorization expires" or "I authorize the release of records created after the date of signature." She closed by offering that the clarification should help, and if a revised authorization is received, to send the request directly to her for importing and processing. She invited any questions.

Lauren S. Lee’s signature block followed: “Thank you, Lauren S. Lee, CRIS; Authorized Mayo Clinic Contractor; Verisma; Director, Client Operations.” Her direct phone number was listed as 904-999-4037, with Customer Service at 507-242-0145, and her email address as lee.lauren@mayo.edu.

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Recvd Call from Client - Checking Status

Advised Summaries are slated to be drafted and Expert Disclosures due in January - Confirmed Trial Date 06.03 in Jeff Cir Div 7 - Client mention another attorney - Advised Client not to speak with me about another attorney - We have covered in the past this 'other attorney' should not be speaking to him about his case - Client expressed understanding - then asked if the 'other attorney' can participate - Advised that is an AW question & decision - Sent Update to AW

episodes.natural_language: Initial client contact on October 31, 2024 with Sarena regarding Muhammad Alif's MVA case (Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022). The client had called to check the status. I advised that summaries are slated to be drafted and that expert disclosures are due in January, and I confirmed the trial date as 06.03 in Jeff Cir Div 7. The client mentioned another attorney, and I advised the client not to speak with me about that other attorney, noting that we have covered in the past that this “other attorney” should not be speaking to him about his case. The client expressed understanding and then asked whether the “other attorney” could participate. I advised that this is an AW question and decision, and I sent an update to AW.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. This note summarizes the email communications regarding Muhammad Alif’s motor vehicle accident claim dated 11/08/22.

On November 7, 2024, Lisa Jewell of Aptiva Health emailed Sarena Tuttle at The Whaley Law Firm with the subject Re: Muhammad Alif MVA 11/08/22. In her message, Lisa asked for an update on the case and whether benefits could be released yet, signing with her name and contact details.

The thread shows an earlier chain of correspondence dating from July 8, 2024. In Sarena Tuttle’s reply, sent at 1:31 PM, she thanked Lisa for reaching out and stated that, at that time, the Personal Injury Protection (PIP) Reservation could not be removed. She explained that Mr. Alif’s claim is in litigation and that multiple providers will ultimately have a claim to the PIP benefits. She noted that once they determine whether the defense is willing to settle or whether the case will proceed to trial, they would have a better understanding of how those funds should and/or will be split. She concluded by saying Lisa could “dairy out 90-120 days to check back in with us.” The message was signed by Sarena M. Tuttle, described as a Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line (D) 502-357-9971; office line (O) 502-583-4022 ext. 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and a note indicating a NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.

Earlier in the same thread, on July 8, 2024, at approximately 12:42 PM, Lisa Jewell replied. She wrote that Farmers had advised benefits are being reserved and that the patient is no longer treating, asking whether benefits could be released. She attached a copy of the itemization for review.

In her signature, Lisa provided contact details: telephone 502-909-0772, email ljewell@aptivahealth.com, website www.aptivahealth.com, and the mailing address 12300 Plantside Drive, Louisville, KY 40299. The message also included the site’s social media icons. A confidentiality notice followed, stating that the email and attachments are intended only for the addressee and may contain legally privileged or confidential information; if received in error, the recipient is instructed to delete the message and notify the sender.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. The client is Muhammad Alif, involved in a motor vehicle accident on November 8, 2022.

In an email thread concerning Muhammad Alif MVA 11/08/22, Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, wrote from 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Her direct lines were (502) 357-9971 (D) and (502) 583-4022 ext. 104 (O), and her email address was Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting a new address). The message was addressed to Lisa Jewell of Aptiva Health, with no one copied on the message. The date stamp on this message is November 7, 2024, 11:37:34 a.m. Eastern Time.

On that same day, November 7, 2024, Lisa Jewell of Aptiva Health sent a reply asking for an update on the case and whether benefits could be released at that time.

Earlier in the correspondence, on July 8, 2024, Lisa Jewell had written to Sarena noting that Farmers had advised benefits were being reserved and that the patient was no longer treating; she asked whether benefits could be released and attached an itemization for review. Sarena responded later that day, July 8, 2024 at 1:31 p.m., explaining that the PIP reservation could not be removed because Mr. Alif’s claim was in litigation and multiple providers would ultimately have a claim to the PIP benefits. She indicated that once it could be determined whether the defense was willing to settle or whether the case would go to trial, they would have a clearer understanding of how those funds should and/or will be split. She also asked Lisa to “dairy out 90-120 days to check back in with us,” and provided her contact details: Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext. 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (new email address).

In Lisa Jewell’s earlier reply, dated July 8, 2024 at 12:42 p.m., she stated that Farmers had advised benefits were being reserved and that the patient was no longer treating, and she asked if benefits could be released. She attached an itemization for review. Her signature block identified her as an AR Billing Specialist at Aptiva Health, with contact details including TEL: (502) 909-0772, email ljewell@aptivahealth.com, and website www.aptivahealth.com, plus the office address at 12300 Plantside Drive, Louisville, KY 40299. The email signatures included standard confidentiality language indicating the message and attachments were intended for the named recipients and may contain privileged information.

In sum, the file reflects a motor vehicle accident case for Muhammad Alif, with a sequence of communications from July 2024 through November 2024. Key points include: ongoing litigation with a PIP reservation in place and multiple providers sharing potential PIP claims; a belief in July 2024 that benefits could not be released due to litigation status; an expectation to reassess in 90–120 days; and a November 2024 update indicating the case was moving to trial, with a trial date set for June 3, 2025, and mediation having failed. The November 7, 2024 correspondence also noted that if anything unforeseen occurred, the office would be contacted with an update.

Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, to provide an update on the bills and records for the services rendered to the patient referenced above. The message stated that the patient is still actively treating with Axon Medical Centers. It emphasized that this is NOT THE FINAL BILL AND RECORDS, and advised that the most recent documents could be found at the Justice Bolt profile for Muhammad Alif via a provided link: https://app.mighty.com/share/59184840-b4f0-4344-ab23-9a731d975505?law_firm=d904fc44-befb-422f-b5ce-e90c6968a3b1&referral_source=Strategic+Medical+Management%2C+LLC. He invited further details or additional documents if needed and signed as Vincent B., Bills and Records Department, Axon Medical Centers, with locations in Dallas, Houston, San Antonio, El Paso, and Austin. The communication included a standard confidentiality disclaimer indicating that the information may be privileged and confidential, including patient information protected by federal and state privacy laws, and that it is intended only for the named recipient. It advised that if the reader was not the intended recipient, review, dissemination, distribution, or duplication is prohibited and directed the reader to contact the sender at admin@amctbi.com or by phone at 855-296-6824 and to destroy all copies of the original message.

On Monday, February 10, 2025, at 10:00:17 AM EST, Sarena M. Tuttle replied to Vincent. In her role as a Litigation Paralegal and Workers' Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Direct dial: 502-357-9971; Office: 502-583-4022 ext. 104; Email: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com; note that a new email address is on file), she acknowledged the update from Axon Medical Centers. She stated that, unfortunately, when a claim is in litigation with the courts, all records and bills must be certified and that downloading items from a portal is not an option. She added that if Axon Medical Centers wishes to update the records and bills they have on file, they should forward a complete and certified copy to date.

The first dated exchange in the record is an inquiry from Cutting Edge Admin to Sarena Tuttle on January 21, 2025, asking for an update on the progress of MUHAMMAD ALIF. Thank you.” The transmission was accompanied by the standard confidentiality and privileged information notices, noting that the information may contain patient information protected by federal and state privacy laws and that the message is intended only for the named recipient; if not the intended recipient, review, dissemination, distribution, or duplication is prohibited and the sender should be contacted at admin@ceostx.com or (975) 978-2525 and copies should be destroyed.

In summary, the record shows a case involving Muhammad Alif with incident details and date of birth as noted, ongoing litigation with a trial scheduled for May 2025, a request in January 2025 for up-to-date records and bills for the case(s), and a February 2025 communication attaching updated records and bills for both the first and second cases. On Monday, March 3, 2025 at 10:30:40 AM GMT-05:00, an email was sent from Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm (agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com) to Dr. Matt (drmatt@amctbi.com) and to the Muhammad Alif MVA 12/09/2022 Filevine project email address MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com.

In the body of the message, Whaley states he is preparing for Mr. Alif’s trial scheduled for June and wants to schedule depositions of his treating doctors at Axon Medical Centers. He asks who would be suggested as the best doctors for testimony on the case and notes he wants any witnesses to provide a comprehensive testimony regarding all of Mr. Alif’s care. He mentions that he was thinking of Dr. William Hwang and Dr. Robert Van Boven and asks for Dr. Matt’s input. He closes by saying he looks forward to hearing from him and thanks him. The email is signed:

Aaron Whaley
Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Ln
Louisville, KY 40222
502-583-4022

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

On March 3, 2025, at 01:53:24 GMT-05:00, an email titled “Re: Muhammad Alif” was sent from Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm to Dr. Matt DeGaetano, with Muhammad Alif MVA 12/09/2022 listed in CC under the Filevine project email address MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com. The body of this message stated simply: “Yes, I have time. what time do you have available?”

Earlier that same day, in the email chain, Dr. Matt DeGaetano replied at approximately 1:51 PM: “Hello Aaron, Let’s jump on a call to discuss, do you have time this afternoon?” The thread shows that prior to this exchange, at around 9:30 AM, Aaron Whaley had written to Dr. DeGaetano with a fuller message regarding preparations for Mr. Alif’s upcoming trial in June. In that 9:30 AM email, Aaron explained that he wanted to schedule time to take depositions of Mr. Alif’s treating doctors at Axon Medical Centers, and he asked which doctors would be best for testimony on the case. He expressed a desire for anyone who testified to provide a comprehensive account of all of Mr. Alif’s care, and he named Dr. William Hwang and Dr. Robert Van Boven as his preferred testifying physicians. He closed by saying he looked forward to hearing back and thanking Dr. DeGaetano. The 9:30 AM message was sent from Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, with the firm’s phone number listed as 502-583-4022.

In the 1:51 PM reply, Dr. DeGaetano signed off as: “Personal Regards, Dr. Matt DeGaetano,” who is the President of Axon Medical Centers. His contact information listed in the signature included O: 972-499-5081 and C: 972-839-2363, and the professional locations noted were Dallas, Houston, San Antonio, El Paso, and Austin.

The 1:53:24 PM email from Aaron, again in the same thread, reiterated the request with: “Yes, I have time. what time do you have available?” This exchange is part of the case record for Muhammad Alif, related to the MVA case dated 11-08-2022, with the communications coordinating depositions and witness testimony ahead of the June trial.
episodes.author: Aaron Whaley
