On July 1, 2025, at 10:11:31 AM (GMT-04:00), counsel Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm sent an email concerning the above matter. The message was addressed to Max Smith, with Muhammad Alif MVA 11/08/2022 - Filevine Project Email Address cc’d. In the body of the email, counsel stated that for calculations, the client’s address is 2139 Lexington Road #116, Louisville, KY 40206. He advised that the attached file contains the confirmation for the client’s stay tonight at the Hampton Inn Lexington Medical Center and invited any questions regarding this matter. The email was signed by W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, whose office is located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. The signature included the firm’s phone number, (502) 365-5043, and fax number, (502) 237-3207. The message also contained a standard confidentiality disclaimer indicating that the electronic transmission is intended only for the named recipient and may contain attorney-client privileged or protected information; if received in error, the recipient is instructed to contact The Whaley Law Firm, and no waiver of privilege applies, and the information should not be used or forwarded to anyone not intended to receive it.

Earlier, on Wednesday, June 25, 2025, at approximately 12:37 PM, Deborah Jackson wrote regarding the same matter. She stated, “Good afternoon, Please see attached correspondence on behalf of Max Smith regarding the above-matter. Thanks and have a great day!” The message was signed by Deborah Jackson, Legal Assistant to George B. Hocker, Ashley K. Brown, Graham D. Barth, Maxwell D. Smith, William J. Barker, II, Kaylee F. Collins and Christianna A. Livas. The message originated from Vine Center, located at 333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507. The firm’s contact details listed were P 859.422.6000 and F 859.422.6001, with the website www.whtlaw.com. The email included a confidentiality notice stating that the information contained in the transmission is privileged and confidential, that if you are not the intended recipient you should not read, distribute, or reproduce the transmission (including attachments), and that if received in error you should delete it and notify the sender so records can be corrected.

Together, these notes document two sequential communications related to the Muhammad Alif case, including the client’s address for calculations, an attached hotel stay confirmation, and the standard confidentiality protections applied to these attorney communications.

A comprehensive case review has been completed for Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022, and all memory blocks have been updated with the current case information pulled from the database tables.

The client is Muhammad Alif, born April 16, 1961, who resides at 2139 Lexington Road #116, Louisville, KY 40206. The motor vehicle accident occurred on November 8, 2022, with the defendant, Jacquelyn B. Wickliffe (Harbor House of Louisville), who failed to yield.

In the litigation, the case is filed in Jefferson Circuit Court, Case No. 23-CI-005509. The trial is scheduled for October 14, 2025, with a pretrial conference set for September 10, 2025 at 11:30 AM.

Medical and insurance details include involvement of 18+ providers for traumatic brain injury and spine injuries, with medical bills totaling more than $57,000. Farmers PIP has been exhausted; West Bend BI has offered $13,000; Farmers UIM is available, and USAA is pending.

Independent medical examinations have been completed by Dr. Chris Stephens on July 2, 2025 and Dr. Richard Edelson on July 11, 2025. Expert depositions are scheduled with Dr. William Hwang on July 17, 2025; Dr. Van Boven on July 29, 2025; and Dr. Fortin on August 14, 2025.

The case summary and status have been updated in the active_cases table.

episodes.natural_language:
This narrative covers the correspondence related to the case Muhammad Alif v. Harbor House, et al., identified as Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022, on behalf of client Muhammad Alif. The chain of emails centers on mediation scheduling, contemplated mediators, and an invoiced independent medical examination (IME).

The matter’s email history began in August 2025 with Deborah Jackson of Vine Center (Lexington, KY) sending a message that included an attached proposed Agreed Order on behalf of Max Smith, asking for permission to add Deborah’s signature and tender the order. Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm replied on August 7, 2025, stating, “That works for me. You have my permission to sign.” The email traffic surrounding the case includes the Filevine project reference Muhammad Alif MVA 12/09/2022, with the Filevine project email address MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com.

On August 25, 2025, Deborah sent another message with an attachment: an invoice from Dr. Edelson’s office for the rescheduled IME set for October 24, 2025, at 8:30 a.m., directing that payment be remitted directly to Dr. Edelson at the address shown on the invoice and inviting any questions or concerns about the invoice. The following day, August 26, 2025, Max Smith followed up separately, requesting proposed mediators for the case so that dates could be set and the mediation could be scheduled. He suggested Pete Palmer or Larry Church as potential mediators but indicated openness to other options as well.

By October 14, 2025, the mediation scheduling effort continued. At 4:29 a.m. that day, an opening message asked, “how about 11/21?” The same day, Deborah Jackson sent a subsequent message listing mediator availability from Larry Church, stating that he had dates that work for them: 11/21, 12/2 pm, 12/3 am, 12/8 pm, 12/19, 12/22 pm, and 12/23, and asked to be advised whether any of these dates would work for the office and for the plaintiff. The thread shows Deborah’s signature block with Vine Center’s contact information, including 333 West Vine Street, Suite 1100, Lexington, KY 40507; P 859.422.6000; F 859.422.6001; www.whtlaw.com, and the standard confidentiality notice.

In the same exchange, Aaron Whaley replied at 11:07 a.m. (with an external email notice) that he was good with the mediators proposed by Deborah, indicating his acceptance of Larry Church (and any other mediator suggested) for the mediation.

The email trail also contains the earlier mediation-related discussions from August 2025. Max Smith’s August 26, 2025 message explicitly asked for proposed mediators so that dates could be secured, with a preference for Pete Palmer or Larry Church, while expressing openness to other options. Deborah’s August 25 message regarding Dr. Edelson’s IME invoice and the August 7 and August 5 messages about the Agreed Order show concurrent steps toward settlement tactics and case management.

Throughout these exchanges, the emails include external-email banners, reflecting that some communications originated from outside the recipient’s organization. The participants consistently referenced the plaintiff Muhammad Alif, the defendants Harbor House and related parties, and the Filevine project address, with the mediation planning and IME arrangements remaining central to the discussion. The communications were conducted through the Vine Center address and Whaley Law Firm, with the signature blocks showing the respective contact details and the file-specific Filevine address.

The file shows a sequence of mid-2025 email communications among counsel and support staff regarding mediation, an agreed order, and a rescheduled IME. The header of the correspondence identifies the matter as Re: Muhammad Alif v. Harbor House, et al., with Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm sending the message to Max Smith of WHT Law, CC’ing Deborah Jackson and the Muhammad Alif MVA 12/09/2022 Filevine project email address. The date on the top message is October 14, 2025 at 11:07:02 GMT-04:00, and the sender notes that he is “good with those mediators.”

The timeline begins with an August 5, 2025 exchange in which Deborah Jackson, legal assistant to several partners at WHT Law (George B. Hocker, Ashley K. Brown, Graham D. Barth, Maxwell D. Smith, William J. Barker II, Kaylee F. Collins and Christianna A. Livas), forwarded a proposed Agreed Order on behalf of Max Smith for review and consideration. She asked for confirmation whether they had permission to add Aaron Whaley’s signature and tender the same. The message was circulated within the firm and included standard confidentiality and privilege notices typical of the firm’s email transmissions.

On August 7, 2025, Aaron Whaley replied, indicating that the proposed order “works for me” and that he gave permission to sign. His response was marked as external email, with the accompanying caution that it originated outside the organization and that recipients should validate its authenticity before acting on it.

A subsequent August 25, 2025 message from Deborah Jackson attached an invoice from Dr. Edelson’s office for a rescheduled independent medical examination (IME) originally set to occur earlier in the case. The IME was rescheduled for October 24, 2025, at 8:30 a.m. Deborah requested that payment be remitted directly to Dr. Edelson at the address listed on the invoice and invited any questions or concerns regarding the invoice. Deborah’s signature block shows her role and the firm’s contact information, followed by the customary confidential notice.

The following day, August 26, 2025, Max Smith sent a reply to Aaron Whaley asking for proposed mediators so that dates could be scheduled and the matter could be put on the calendar. He suggested Pete Palmer or Larry Church as potential mediators but stated he was open to other options as well. The message was signed by Max Smith and included his firm’s contact details and standard confidentiality language.

Finally, on October 14, 2025, Aaron Whaley responded with a succinct confirmation that he was good with the mediators discussed. The thread includes the same Filevine project email address circulated in the CC line, and the chain shows ongoing collaboration among the teams at Whaley Law Firm and WHT Law Firm regarding mediation, the Agreed Order, and the IME scheduling.

Throughout the correspondence, the communications reflect standard firm practices: proposed documents requiring sign-off, conditional approvals to sign, a request to set mediator dates, and an invoiced IME with payment instructions, all within the context of the Muhammad Alif v. Harbor House matter. The exchanges include the expected legal-support staff roles and internal confidentiality notices, and they align with the case file’s timeline and mediation planning.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

On October 24, 2025, in the matter titled “Re: Progressive on behalf of Progressive Casualty Insurance Company Claim #22-8451213,” Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm sent an email from agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com to Natasha Fortune at Progressive and to Muhammad Alif’s MVA 12/09/2022 Filevine project email address MuhammadAlifZ2328962@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com. The message, dated Friday, October 24, 2025 at 03:08:12 GMT-04:00, began with: “Here you go. Thank you for taking a look.”

In reply, on the same date, Natasha Fortune wrote back at approximately 2:45 PM: “Hello Attorney Whaley, I just wanted to follow up on our conversation regarding your client Muhammad Alif for DOL 12/09/2022. Please forward medicals and specials for the prior loss so that I may review them. I am looking forward to working towards resolving this claim with you.” Her signature block followed, listing her as a Claims Generalist Intermediate for Progressive, with a P.O. Box in Cleveland, OH 44101-9919, a phone number of 518-560-3853, a fax number of 833-905-1748, and the email Natasha_Fortune@Progressive.com. She also noted her hours of availability as Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM.

The thread closes with the closing signature from Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, with a contact phone number of 502-583-4022.

Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 for client Muhammad Alif underwent the Medical Records Organization Complete process for November 2022. The work included consolidating 58 duplicate folders into 28 organized folders, merging 40 duplicate folders into 18 canonical provider names, and flagging 10 folders with the '_REVIEW_' prefix for manual review. A total of 248 files were organized and preserved with zero data loss.

A Unified Client Folder was created at /projects/Muhammad-Alif-Client-Medical-Records/ containing records from both accidents (Nov 2022 and Dec 2022, respectively labeled as Accident-1-Nov-08-2022/ and Accident-2-Dec-09-2022/).

Provider overlap shows 8 providers treated for both accidents, 10 providers only in November, and 5 providers only in December.

Next Steps: Review 10 _REVIEW_ folders (30 files) to determine if the providers are legitimate; review the December case _NEEDS_REVIEW folder (32 files) with ambiguous provider names; update Medical Providers JSON if needed; and perform cross-accident causation analysis.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022 for client Muhammad Alif.

The medical records folder organization was completed. A total of 58 duplicate/variant folders were consolidated down to 28 organized folders, and 40 duplicate folders were merged into 18 canonical provider names in alignment with the Medical Providers JSON. All files were preserved with no data loss, and the existing subfolder structure was maintained (Medical Bills/, Medical Records/, Medical Requests/). Ten folders were flagged with an '_REVIEW_' prefix for manual review because their providers are not on the official list.

Key consolidations included: Cutting Edge Orthopedic variants (3 folders) were consolidated into Cutting Edge Orthopedics; Innovation/Innovative Open MRI variants (4 folders) were consolidated into Innovation Open MRI; Parkridge variants (3 folders) were consolidated into Parkridge Medical Center; Norton facility variants (multiple) were consolidated into canonical Norton names; KORT variants (3 folders) were consolidated into KORT Physical Therapy - Shelbyville; and Lynn Family variants (3 folders) were consolidated into Lynn Family Sports & Vision Training.

Review needed: _REVIEW_ASP Cares, _REVIEW_Brazos NeuroScience, _REVIEW_DFW Open MRI, _REVIEW_Envision Imaging, _REVIEW_Healix Pathology, _REVIEW_LEGENT Orthopedic Hospital, _REVIEW_Norton Women and Childrens Hospital, _REVIEW_Spine Vue, _REVIEW_Tri-State Injury and Rehab, _REVIEW_Whaley Law Firm.

Reports Generated: Medical_Records_Folder_Organization_Report.md (detailed) and Medical_Records_Organization_Summary.md (quick reference).

Execution Time: approximately 61 seconds. Files Processed: 200+ files moved and organized.
